17076.description: The Youghiogheny Scenic and Wild River is part of the large Mississippi River watershed that stretches from the western slope of the Appalachian Mountains in the east to the Rockies in the west. Beginning in the gently rolling farmlands of southern Garrett County, the Youghiogheny cuts a northward path through some of the most rugged mountain scenery in Maryland before running into Pennsylvania and merging with the Monongahela at McKeesport, Pennsylvania.

23669.name: Blue Jay Point County Park

activities.name: Blue Jay Point County Park
activities.description: Nice hiking area.

23669.description: Blue Jay Point County Park is a 236-acre park located on the shores of Falls Lake in northern Wake County. Blue Jay Point's mission is to offer environmental education programming in a natural setting. Amenities include picnic facilities, open play areas, playgrounds and educational gardens and exhibits.

2763.name: Lagomarsino Petroglyphs

activities.name: Lagomarsino Petroglyphs
activities.description: Lagomarsino Petroglyphs features 15 miles of hiking trails near Reno/virginia City, NV.

2763.directions: South of Reno on I-395 to Mt Rose Junction left on HWY 341 toward Virginia City. About 7 miles turn left onto Catwright road to the fire station at about 3 miles.

25292.name: Clayton Park

activities.name: Clayton Park
activities.description: The forested, hilly trails of this park have become a popular destination for hikers, equestrians, and bicyclists. Enter from Emley's Hill Road ( 6 miles of trails).

25292.directions: Interstate 195 to exit 11 (Imlaystown/Cox's Corner). Eastbound, turn right and follow to end; westbound, turn left and follow to end. Turn left onto Rt. 526 and make immediate right onto Imlaystown-Davis Station Rd. Follow to Emley's Hill Rd., turn left. Follow to Park on left.
25292.description: You'll feel many miles away from civilization as this rustic 422-acre site in rural Upper Freehold is located amidst the rolling farmland of western Monmouth County. One of the most beautiful parks in the county system, the property is known for stately stands of red and white oak, beech, ash and birch trees.

25293.name: Crosswicks Creek Greenway

activities.name: Crosswicks Creek Greenway
activities.description: Crosswicks Creek begins near Fort Dix in Burlington County, travels up the northeast corner of Ocean County, meanders 7 miles in Monmouth County, becomes the dividing line between Burlington and Mercer Counties and finally empties into the Delaware River.

25293.directions: Take I-195 west to exit 16 (Route 537 west) or follow Rt. 537 west from Freehold. Past Holmes Mill Road approx 1/4 mile. Turn right into parking lot for Rt. 537/Monmouth Road lot access.  Continue past lot and trun right onto Province Line Road and right into lot for fishing hole access. Continue past lot and turn right onto Hutchinson Road. Lot access is on right after bend in road.
25293.description: Crosswicks Creek Greenway, with Historic Walnford as its centerpiece, is a 1500  acre greenway in Upper Freehold Township. Most of the Crosswicks Creek Greenway forms a narrow corridor of land around Crosswicks Creek. Another 2,700 acres of surrounding farmland is preserved by the county and state Farmland Preservation Program.

25294.name: Hartshorne Woods Park

activities.name: Hartshorne Woods Park
activities.description: Hartshorne Woods Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Red Bank, NJ.

25294.description: A hilly, forested 787-acre site overlooking the Navesink River, this park is among the highest elevations along the Atlantic Coast and features prominently in area history as a former coastal defense site.  Known for its challenging trail system and scenic views, Hartshorne Woods is a popular park for area hikers, bicyclists and outdoor enthusiasts.

25295.name: Holmdel Park

activities.name: Holmdel Park
activities.description: Walking trails wind through the shady woods and rolling hills. There is a fitness trail too. The rolling terrain will challenge some hikers. Cyclists and equestrians are asked to use the trails in the Ramenessin section but must remain on the roads in the Northern portion in this popular park. Enter from Longstreet Road. (9.49 miles of trails)

25295.description: Holmdel Park is one of Monmouth County's most popular locations for active recreation and nature appreciation. Acquired by the Park System in 1962, nearly one million visitors enjoy this 565-acre site yearly. This park features Historic Longstreet Farm, the David C. Shaw Arboretum, fishing, picnic areas, four tennis courts, two playgrounds, ice skating, sledding and 10 miles of trails - including a 1/2 mile paved loop linking the Pond View and Forest Edge areas of the park with group picnic facilities and playgrounds.

25296.name: Manasquan Reservoir

activities.name: Manasquan Reservoir
activities.description: The 5.1 mile gravel Perimeter Trail offers panoramic views of the Reservoir and provides a great trail experience for all users.  This trail loops all the way around the reservoir and has a fairly even, well-maintained surface and is designated as a MODERATE trail due to its length. Mileposts are marked on the trail. An additional 1.1 mile Cove Trail is a scenic nature trail which explores the lakeshore around the Environmental Center and is open to pedestrains only.

25296.directions: Garden State Parkway to Exit 98, Interstate 195 west. Proceed on I-195 west to Exit 28B, Rt. 9 north-Freehold. Stay in right lane when entering Rt. 9 north. At first traffic light, turn right onto Georgia Tavern Road. Follow Georgia Tavern Road for 0.3 mile. Continue straight for Environmental Center on right or turn right onto Windeler Rd. and continue 1.5 miles to the Visitor Center Reservoir Area on left.
25296.description:
Spend a day fishing, boating, or walking the trail at this beautiful spot in southern 
Monmouth County. Now the most visited site in the Monmouth County Park System, over one million visitors come to the Manasquan Reservoir each year.

25297.name: Perrineville Lake Park

activities.name: Perrineville Lake Park
activities.description: In addition to access to the lake, there are two trails. The Lakeside Loop is a 1.5 mile multi-use trail on Agress Road. The Pine Creek Trail is a 1 mile unpaved multi-use trail on Baird Road.

25297.directions: From the Garden State Parkway or the NJ Turnpike, take Interstate 195 to Exit 16 (Route 537, Freehold). Rt 537 East for 1/2 mile to Route 571. Turn left (north) onto Millstone Road (Rt 571) and proceed north 3 1/2 miles to intersection of Millstone Road and Perrineville Road/Sweetman's Lane. Turn left and proceed 1/2 mile west to lake.
25297.description: Enjoy the peace, quiet, and natural beauty of this 897-acre site in Millstone & Roosevelt while angling for bass or catfish in the lake. Watercraft can be launched into the lake where visitors can canoe, kayak, and fish (car top, electric powered boats only).  Lake access is on Perrineville Road/Sweetman's Lane (between Agress Road & Millstone Road).

25298.name: Turkey Swamp Park

activities.name: Turkey Swamp Park
activities.description: Multi-use and fitness trails traverse the park which is located at the northern end of the NJ Pine Barrens. Turkey Swamp's terrain is relatively level and the 17 acre lake adds scenic interest.

25298.directions: NJ Turnpike to Exit 7A to Interstate 195 east. Follow I-195 east. Follow I-195 to exit 22. Turn left onto Jackson Mills Rd. north. Follow Jackson Mills Rd. to Georgia Rd., turn left and follow 1.7 miles to main park entrance.
25298.description: This 2,173 acre wooded park was acquired and developed with campers in mind. A major attraction is the 17-acre lake for fishing, boating, and ice-skating. The park also features miles of trails, an archery range and playgrounds.

25299.name: Union Transportation Trail

activities.name: Union Transportation Trail
activities.description: The Union Transportation Trail is the County's second rail-trail, ideal for equestrians, hikers, walkers, joggers and bicyclists.  The first two miles of this gravel trail, opened in 2010, includes a rehabilitated historic wood trestle bridge over Lahaway Creek, which is one of the few physical remnants of the old railroad. Two parking lots and access points are available at Millstream Road, Rt. 537 and Jonathan Holmes Road.

25299.description: The Union Transportation Trail is the County's second rail-trail, ideal for equestrians, hikers, walkers, joggers and bicyclists.  The first two miles of this gravel trail, opened in 2010, includes a rehabilitated historic wood trestle bridge over Lahaway Creek, which is one of the few physical remnants of the old railroad. Two parking lots and access points are available at Millstream Road, Rt. 537 and Jonathan Holmes Road.

25300.name: Lake Towhee Park

activities.name: Lake Towhee Park
activities.description: A beautiful park with playgrounds, picnic facilities, ball field, nature area & interpretive programs.

25300.description: A beautiful park with playgrounds, picnic facilities, ball field, nature area & interpretive programs.

21966.name: LMU to Tipprell Rd trail

activities.name: LMU to Tipprell Rd trail
activities.description: LMU to Tipprell Rd trail is a 5 mile hiking trail in Harrogate, Tennessee.

21966.directions: Start at the LMU water tower on campus.  Follow fireroad to the left for .9 miles.  Go through gate and stay on the fireroad that leads up or to the right.  Continue for .5 miles on the fireroad until you see a sign on the left that states "no horses."  Take this double track that turns into single track for about .3 miles.  You will see an orange ribbon on the left.  Take this DH trail to Tipprell Rd and then if you want either come back up or take Cumberland Gap greenway trail back to campus.

activities.name: Playwicki Park
activities.description: Playgrounds, picnicking, hiking, fishing.

18553.name: Medoc Mountain State Park

activities.name: Medoc Mountain State Park
activities.description:
Medoc Mountain State Park is a park close to urban areas that offers a perfect escape from work. The park has beautiful foot trails for hiking and plenty of nature to explore. Camping, canoeing, fishing and picnicking are other common activities here. The park also offer interpretive programs.<br />
The park offers seven trails that equal a little more than 10 miles when combined. Most of the trails are easy or moderate in difficulty, and trail scenery includes an artesian well, granite outcroppings and miniature rapids. Winding along Little Fishing Creek, around the high ridge of Medoc Mountain and through the forests, the trails are the best way to appreciate the beauty and diversity of Medoc Mountain.

18553.directions: 1541 Medoc State Park Road, Hollister, NC 27844
18553.description: Medoc Mountain State Park is a park close to urban areas that offers a perfect escape from work. The park has beautiful foot trails for hiking and plenty of nature to explore. Camping, canoeing, fishing and picnicking are other common activities here. The park also offer interpretive programs.

25305.name: Tinicum Park

activities.name: Tinicum Park
activities.description: The barn at Tinicum Park is available to rent for many occasions.  The wooded park atmosphere provides the perfect setting for wedding pictures, reunions or parties; located in Erwinna.  For further information, please call the Historic Properties Office at (215) 348-6627.

25305.description: The barn at Tinicum Park is available to rent for many occasions.  The wooded park atmosphere provides the perfect setting for wedding pictures, reunions or parties; located in Erwinna.  For further information, please call the Historic Properties Office at (215) 348-6627.

25306.name: Tohickon Valley Park

activities.name: Tohickon Valley Park
activities.description: Most of the current trails, used mainly for mountain biking and hiking were on logging roads. Oak, Hickory, Tulip Popular, Hemlock and White Pines were used extensively. The Tulip Poplar is the most colorful with greenish, orange flowers and maple-shaped leaves. Look for these blooms in middle to late spring. They are usually the straightest and tallest trees in the forest.

25306.description: The Tohickon Creek actually begins in Richland Township but for purposes of this article, we will focus on the stretch from the dam at Lake Nockamixon to Point Pleasant. This comprises 11.5 miles with alternating bands of Triassic shales, sandstones, and argillites, which line its bed. It has been identified and may one day be classified as a National Natural Landmark. The stream is currently classified as a (CWF) cold water fishery and is stocked with trout each year. Surveys conducted by the Bucks County Audubon Society state that the creek valley houses 82 bird species, including 4 species of rare concern and 10 rare breeders.

4116.name: Dobbin House Trail

activities.name: Dobbin House Trail
activities.description: Dobbin House Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Davis, WV.

4116.directions: From Davis, WV enter Blackwater Falls State Park.  At the 4 way stop, go right, past the campground and take the next road on your right (Pendleton Lake parking).  Note the gate on your left just before the parking lot.  This is the road you'll want to ride down.

25328.name: Forked River Mountain

activities.name: Forked River Mountain
activities.description: 7 mile hiking trail located near Forked River, New Jersey

25328.directions: Need 4x4 to get there. Or ride MTB for 4-5 miles to get to trail head. Can get there from Stonehill Rd. on corner of Lacey Rd and Parkway in Forked River. Or Bryant Rd from south near Wells Mills Park on 532. Or Bryant Rd off of 539

2808.name: Forest Park Trail Network

activities.name: Forest Park Trail Network
activities.description: Forest Park Trail Network features 9 miles of hiking trails near Queens, NY.

2808.directions: E or F train Union Turnpike st.1/4 mile north of park.go east fr/trail head located right of gate on Forest park dr. and Metropolitan ave. Hookup w/locals for big loop or make up your own trails thoughout whole park even across Woodhaven blvd. on south side of park. Explore.

9001.name: Bear Creek Lake State Park

activities.name: Bear Creek Lake State Park
activities.description: Bear Creek Lake State Park is located within the Cumberland State Forrest in Central Virginia. It contains a 40-acre lake with a boat launch, fishing, pier, boat rentals and a swimming beach. Other Activities here include biking, camping, hiking and horseback riding.

9001.directions: The park is about 4.5 miles northwest of the town of Cumberland. From U.S. Route 60, go west on Route 622 and south on Route 629 to the park entrance.
9001.description: Bear Creek Lake State Park is located within the Cumberland State Forrest in Central Virginia. It contains a 40-acre lake with a boat launch, fishing, pier, boat rentals and a swimming beach. Other Activities here include biking, camping, hiking and horseback riding.

9003.name: Fairy Stone State Park

activities.name: Fairy Stone State Park
activities.description: Known for its legendary fairy stones, Fairy Stone State Park contains a 168-acre lake that is a hotbed for fishing. Activities here include camping, swimming, hiking, mountain biking horseback riding, fishing and boating (electric only).

9003.directions: From I-81 near Roanoke, take Route 581 to Route 220 South to Route 57 West to Route 346 North (Fairystone Lake Drive).<br /><br />From I-77 near Hillsville, take Route 58 East to Route 8 North to Route 57 East to Route 346 North (Fairystone Lake Drive). <br /><br />From Greensboro, take Route 220 North to Route 220 North bypass at Martinsville, then Route 57 West to Route 346 North (Fairystone Lake Drive).<br /><br />From Richmond, take Route 360 West to Route 58 West to Route 220 North Bypass at Martinsville to Route 57 West to Route 346 North (Fairystone Lake Drive)
9003.description: Known for its legendary fairy stones, Fairy Stone State Park contains a 168-acre lake that is a hotbed for fishing. Activities here include camping, swimming, hiking, mountain biking horseback riding, fishing and boating (electric only).

19247.name: Lake Poinsett Recreation Area

activities.name: Lake Poinsett Recreation Area
activities.description: The scenic George S. Mickelson Trail stretches over one hundred miles through the Black Hills. The gentle slopes and easy access of the converted railroad track allow people of all ages and abilities to enjoy the beauty of the Black HIlls.

19247.description: One of the largest lakes in the state, Lake Poinsett was named after Joel Poinsett who served as U.S. Secretary of War. He was instrumental in promoting the expedition of Joseph Nicollet and John Fremont who first explored the region in 1838. The party camped on the north side of Lake Poinsett. Today, the lakeshore still provides excellent camping opportunities, as well as many other recreational activities.

3208.name: Quebec Run Trails Near

activities.name: Quebec Run Trails Near
activities.description: Quebec Run Trails Near features 20 miles of hiking trails near Elliottsville, PA.

3208.directions: Leaving Elliottsville take Quebec Rd. east to Skyline Drive, then a left on Wirsing Rd.  Parking will be on the left at the bottom of the hill.  Easily accessed from Bruceton Mills, WV which is actually closer than Elliottsville.

activities.name: Lake Claire Trail
activities.description: The Lake Claire Trail Loop is located on UCF property. It is a 3.15 loop around a recreational lake. There are picnic areas, beach, volleyball, canoe and kayaking available. Parking is free and there are full bathroom facilities.

3209.name: Roaring Run

activities.name: Roaring Run
activities.description: Roaring Run features 20 miles of hiking trails near Apollo, PA.

3209.directions: starting from the intersection of route 22 and 66 just outside of Murrysville/Delmont<br /><br />Head north on 66 until you get into Apollo go across the bridge in town and at the very first light turn right you will pass the Mozey Inn on your right and Patricks Pub on your left (both good spots for a post ride brew) <br /><br />follow the very narrow road all the way to the end and you will hit a parking lot, here you will find the rail trail start down it and the trails are all over on your left opposite the river.

23352.name: Rhododendron

activities.name: Rhododendron
activities.description: The Rhododendron trail is short and easy branch of the Tanasi Trail System. It starts at the Ocoee Whitewater Center and closely follows the sheer rock edges of the Ocoee river.

23352.directions: Ocoee Whitewater Center<br /><br />4400 U.S. 64, Copperhill, TN &#8206;

4924.name: White Clay Creek State Park Triple Loop

activities.name: White Clay Creek State Park Triple Loop
activities.description: White Clay Creek State Park Triple Loop features 10 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

4924.directions: Take Exit 1 off I-95 at stop sign make a Left onto DE-896(College Ave.) toward Newark. Make a right at Chestnut Hill Road intersection there are signs to follow DE-2 East, DE-72, and DE-4. You will go past the UD football stadium. Make a Left onto DE-2/DE-72. Follow DE-2 East as it becomes Capitol Trail. Make a Left on DE-72 heads/Possum Park Road. Go straight, you will come to and Intersection with Paper Mill Road. Turn Right on Paper Mill Road. After you pass Fox Den Road on your Right Look for the Park Entrance, it should be your next Left. There is a parking area at the Trailhead for Bryan's Field Trail.<br /><br />If you want a map of the Park you can stop at the Park office. <br />Directions: Same as above until you get to the intersection of DE-72/Possum Park Rd & Paper Mill Road. At that light go straight onto Thompson Station Rd. The Park Office will be on your Right across from Chamber Rock Rd. This is also another Trail head at the David English Trail.<br /><br />There is a parking fee May thru October I believe. I think it's $3 for instate plates and $6 for out of state. There are plenty of places to park and ride to the trailhead around if you don't want to pay it. If you make a Left at the intersection of Paper Mill Road and Possom Park Rd there is a Shopping Center with a Dunkin Donuts that works out okay.

1164.name: Middle Run/white Clay Combo Ride

activities.name: Middle Run/White Clay
activities.description: Middle Run/White Clay features 20 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

1164.directions: From DE-2 Kirkwood HWY/Capitol Trail turn up Polly Drummond Hill Road at the Light. You can park at the Judge Morris Estate and pay or try parking at Pike Creek Christian Academy. PCCA will be on your Left at the top of the hill after the Light coming from Kirkwood HWY.

3165.name: Pine Creek Rail Trail

activities.name: Pine Creek Rail Trail
activities.description: Pine Creek Rail Trail features 64 miles of hiking trails near Jersey Shore, PA.

3165.directions: The Pine Creek Rail Trail is approximately 65 miles (105 km) from end to end, and it generally follows a north-south orientation. The trail is located wholly within Tioga and Lycoming Counties.<br /><br /><br /><br />The trail's northern terminus is near the intersection of U.S. Route 6 and Pennsylvania Route 287, about 3 miles (4.8 km) north of Wellsboro. (Parking is located at the southernmost end of Butler Road). The trail parallels Route 6 in a southwesterly direction for about 6 miles (9.7 km) until it reaches the village of Ansonia. South of Ansonia, the trail parallels Pine Creek as it goes south along the floor of the Grand Canyon of Pennsylvania. It passes through Leonard Harrison State Park and the Tioga State Forest. Approximately 17 miles (27 km) south of Ansonia, the trail passes through the village of Blackwell.[2] The section between Ansonia and Blackwell is very remote, and much of the trail is inaccessible by road.<br /><br /><br /><br />South of Blackwell, the trail enters Lycoming County and the Tiadaghton State Forest. It parallels Pennsylvania Route 414 for about 25 miles (40 km). Pennsylvania Route 414 ends in the unincorporated village of Waterville. South of Waterville, the trail parallels Pennsylvania Route 44 for approximately 17 miles (27 km) until the trail reaches its southern terminus in Jersey Shore (Parking at Railroad St and Humes St.) Between Blackwell and Jersey Shore, the trail crosses the highway and Pine Creek several times, and it is almost always within sight of both the road and the creek.<br /><br />Pine Creek Rail Trail near Blackwell (2005)<br /><br /><br /><br />Boroughs, villages, and attractions located along or near the trail (from north to south):<br /><br /><br /><br />    * Wellsboro is located about 3 miles (4.8 km) from the trail's northern terminus.<br /><br />    * Asaph<br /><br />    * Ansonia<br /><br />    * Leonard Harrison State Park<br /><br />    * Colton Point State Park is located on the western side of Pine Creek, but no public bridges span the creek between Ansonia and Blackwell.<br /><br />    * Tioga State Forest<br /><br />    * Tiadaghton<br /><br />    * Blackwell<br /><br />    * Tiadaghton State Forest<br /><br />    * Cedar Run (Brown Township)<br /><br />    * Slate Run<br /><br />    * Cammal (McHenry Township)<br /><br />    * Jersey Mills<br /><br />    * Waterville (Cummings Township)<br /><br />    * Little Pine State Park is located about 8 miles (13 km) north of Waterville.<br /><br />    * Watson Township<br /><br />    * Porter Township<br /><br />    * Jersey Shore<br /><br />

15503.name: Falls Hallow Trail

activities.name: Falls Hallow Trail
activities.description: A Yellow blazed trail leads you along an access road that gives way to follow a stream with at least two waterfalls. The second part of the trail takes a sharp left cutting across the mountain face leading you to yet another access road.  The steap access road takes you to the summit for a total of 2,425 ft. gain in elevation.  Summit elevation- 4,463 ft.

15503.directions: Trailhead is off of VA 42 South of Buffalo Gap.  A pull out with a Gate and a sign showing the address as 291 allows for a small place to park.  The gate bears a sign restricting vehicles, but gives use to those on foot.  Past the gate a sign marking the the trail leads you on your way.

5757.name: Appalachian Trail 102: Culvers Gap to NJ 23

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 102: Culvers Gap to NJ 23
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 14.3 miles from Culvers Gap (US Hwy 206) to NJ Hwy 23 (High Point State Park). Along the way it passes Culvers Lake, the Gren Anderson shelter, Sunrise Mountain, the Sunrise Mountain Pavilion, Mashipacong shelter, Deckertown Turnpike, and the Rutherford shelter.

21649.name: East Branch Clarion River Lake

activities.name: East Branch Clarion River Lake
activities.description: Interpretive trails in East Branch Dam Recreation Area.

21649.description: Elk State Park is located at this lake in scenic western Pennslyvania, 14 miles north east of Johnsonburg.

25479.name: King Fisher

activities.name: King Fisher
activities.description: 1 mile hiking trail located near Greensboro, North Carolina

25479.directions: Located at the end of the Blue Heron Yanceyville St.

3223.name: Sassafras Loop

activities.name: Sassafras Loop
activities.description: Sassafras Loop features 23 miles of hiking trails near Rothrock State Forest, PA.

3223.directions: Trail head is from the parking lot at the park Office in Greenwood Furnace State Park south of State College on PA-305.

23449.name: Deer Lakes Park

activities.name: Deer Lakes Park
activities.description: Great walking/hiking/jogging trails.

23449.description: Deer Lakes Park is a good illustration of the development of natural assets into a specific park idea. Deer Lakes already had a large man-made lake that was used for fishing, and during its development that lake was improved and two other lakes added, all using the same water-shed and leading one to the other. The lakes are spring fed, and construction of dams and new settling basins have made the site a paradise for fishermen. Additional facilities include a ballfield, a children's play area, shelters, a spray park, disc golf course and observatory.

23450.name: Harrison Hills Park

activities.name: Harrison Hills Park
activities.description: Excellent trails for hiking and jogging.

23450.description: Harrison Hills Park in Harrison Township occupies the extreme northeast portion of Allegheny County, bordering the Allegheny River and offering a magnificent overlook in which the viewer can see three other counties -Westmoreland, Butler and Armstrong. The theme of the picnic groves and shelters is seeing birds, trees and plants: Wake Robin, Laurel, Buckeye and Overlook. Amenities include a children's play area, 3 soccer fields, streams, waterfalls, ponds, a birding area, and guided walks and nature camps.

23452.name: North Park

activities.name: North Park
activities.description: Walking, Jogging, Hiking trails; exercise trail.

23452.description: 3,075 acres located in Hampton, McCandless and Pine Townships. Amenities include golfing, ball fields, groves, shelters and rental buildings, horseshoes, boat house, playgrounds, tennis courts, remote control airplane field.

23453.name: Round Hill Park

activities.name: Round Hill Park
activities.description: At Round Hill Park in Elizabeth township in the southeast corner of the county there is a modern working farm that supplements the park itself. The exhibit farm is open every day of the year and affords tens of thousands of school students on field trips, and daily visitors, an interpretive program that revolves around the farm, and the water and food cycles of life. The 17 picnic groves reflect the life of a farm with names like Alfalfa, Timothy, Wagon Wheel and Quiet Acres.

23453.description: At Round Hill Park in Elizabeth township in the southeast corner of the county there is a modern working farm that supplements the park itself. The exhibit farm is open every day of the year and affords tens of thousands of school students on field trips, and daily visitors, an interpretive program that revolves around the farm, and the water and food cycles of life. The 17 picnic groves reflect the life of a farm with names like Alfalfa, Timothy, Wagon Wheel and Quiet Acres.

23454.name: Settlers Cabin Park

activities.name: Settlers Cabin Park
activities.description: Great trails.

23454.description: Archaeologists from Carnegie Museum of Natural History helped identify the origins of the 1780 log cabin that gives Settlers Cabin Park its name. The themes of the 11 groves and shelters are Indian names: Algonquin, Seneca, Apache, Tomahawk. The region was famous for its high output of shallow coal, and was a maze of abandoned open and back-filled mines when the county secured it. Active wells and exposed oil and gas lines were initial problems, but the grading and reforestation of the land has restored it to rolling wooded slopes and meadows. At 1589 acres, this park was intended to be the largest of the regional parks, and still has a wild, rugged, and unexplored quality not found in the other parks. Located between the Greater Pittsburgh International Airport and Pittsburgh, this large 1589 acre park will see development in the future as population west of Pittsburgh increases. Settlers Cabin has the most heavily used of the county's three wave pools. The location along the major route to the airport makes it accessible, and swimmers from Ohio and West Virginia can easily reach the site. An impressive diving platform adds to the attraction.

23456.name: White Oak Park

activities.name: White Oak Park
activities.description: Several walking/hiking/jogging trails.

23456.description: In White Oak Park near McKeesport there are plants that exist nowhere else in the state. Trillium, wildflowers and particular types of groundcover have attracted the attention of botanists, and the western border of the park is rugged steep hillside that only the most adventurous hikers spend time on. Some of the stands of trees are primeval. The picnic groves have tree names such as Mountain Ash, Juniper, Beech, and Sumac.

2889.name: Canal Trail

activities.name: Canal Trail
activities.description: Canal Trail features 5 miles of hiking trails near Mohawk, NY.

2889.directions: At the intersection of 5s and Mohawk St., parking area behind (and to the left) of Movac Ambulance building.

19615.name: Chippokes Plantation State Parks

activities.name: Chippokes Plantation State Parks
activities.description: Great hiking.

19615.directions: Surry County. From I-95 and I-295, take Route 10 towards Hopewell. Follow Route 10 East for approximately 40 miles to Surry. Turn left at the intersection of routes 10 and 31 (this continues on Route 10). Turn right at the stop light. Turn left at Route 634 (Alliance Road), and the park entrance is four miles on the left.
19615.description: Just across the James River from historic Jamestown, Chippokes Plantation is one of the oldest continually farmed plantations in the country. A working farm since 1619, the park offers modern recreational activities and a glimpse of life in a bygone era. Visitors tour the historic area with its antebellum mansion and outbuildings, stroll through formal gardens, and view antique equipment at the Chippokes Farm and Forestry Museum. A campground and four overnight cottages allow visitors to stay on the historic grounds. The park has an Olympic-sized swimming pool and a visitor center with a gift shop. It also provides opportunities to bike, hike, ride horseback and picnic. Chippokes Plantation also offers wedding packages and meeting facilities.

25567.name: Niagara River Recreation Trail (Ontario, Canada)

activities.name: Niagara River Recreation Trail (Ontario, Canada)
activities.description:
TRAIL Length 35 Miles DIFFICULTY:  ACTIVITIES: Hiking & Walking, Cycling - Roads & Paths CHARACTER: Natural, Scenic, Historic <br />
SURFACE: Paved AMENITIES: Wheel Chair Accessible

25567.directions: LOCATION REGION: Niagara  SUB-REGION: <br /><br />Niagara Peninsula  <br /><br />CLOSEST TOWN(S): <br /><br />Fonthill  GPS: Latitude :  43.25239 Longitude :  -79.05986 CONTACT INFO <br /><br />NAME: Niagara Peninsula Conservation Authority , Admin  PHONE: 905-788-3135

23719.name: Hackensack River County Park

activities.name: Hackensack River County Park
activities.description: Walking trails & boardwalk.

23719.description: Hackensack River County Park stretches over 28 acres of land along the Hackensack River in the northern section of Hackensack.

23533.name: Ellanor C. Lawrence Park

activities.name: Ellanor C. Lawrence Park
activities.description: Beautiful area for hiking.

23533.description: Located in western Fairfax County, Ellanor C. Lawrence Park was established to preserve large areas of open space, protect natural and cultural features and provide a wide variety of recreational opportunities for the public. Visitors will find a unique experience whether visiting to bird watch, hike, exercise, discover the natural and cultural history of the land, picnic, participate in organized sports, attend an educational program or just relax.

23536.name: Huntley Meadows Park

activities.name: Huntley Meadows Park
activities.description: Some of the best wildlife watching in the Washington metropolitan area is enjoyed here. From the ½ mile wetland boardwalk trail and observation tower, people have excellent views of beavers, frogs, dragonflies and herons. Huntley Meadows is well known as a prime birding spot, with over 200 species identified in the park.

23536.directions: From US Hwy 1 North, exit Hwy 723 to the left. Turn left into park.
23536.description: Nestled in Fairfax County's Hybla Valley, Huntley Meadows Park is a rich, natural and historical island of over 1,500 acres in the suburban sea of Northern Virginia. It harbors a nationally significant historic house, majestic forests, wildflower-speckled meadows and vast wetlands bursting with life.

23537.name: Riverbend Regional Park

activities.name: Riverbend Regional Park
activities.description: Portion of the Potomac Heritage Trail.

23537.description: Tucked away in a remote river setting, Riverbend Park has over 400 acres of forest, meadows, and ponds. Trails include a 2.5 mile portion of the Potomac Heritage Trail linking national and regional parkland. Kayakers and canoeists can enjoy exploring many islands in the Potomac River. Serious anglers and families can bring a boat or fish from the shady riverbank. Nature highlights include spectacular river views, beautiful wildflowers and birds. Park grounds are open from 7am to dusk, hours posted. Gates are locked at closing time.

23538.name: Turner Farm

activities.name: Turner Farm
activities.description: Jogging and walking trails

23538.directions: The Turner Farm is located at the intersection of Georgetown Pike (Route 193) and Springvale Road (Route 674) in Great Falls, Virginia, within the Dranesville District. The park entrance is on Springvale Road.
23538.description: This peaceful and serene 52-acre park is located on the site of a former dairy farm. Its rolling pastures and dairy barn complement the semi-rural community of Great Falls, Virginia. The land was saved from development by a public/private partnership started in 1994 to "Save-the-Farm." Private donations and volunteer efforts continue to supplement the Park Authority's limited budget for this facility.

3239.name: Moon Lake Park

activities.name: Moon Lake Park
activities.description: Moon Lake Park features 30 miles of hiking trails near Plymouth, PA.

3239.directions: Location 196 Moon Lake Rd, Hunlock Creek, PA 18621<br /><br />Local Directions: Located a few minutes southwest of Wilkes Barre, Pa. Take RT. 29 North from West Nanticoke approximately 6 miles to a left on Moon lake Rd. Stay left at the split onto Atherton Rd. and continue for about 1 mile to a left into the park.

3241.name: Evansburg State Park

activities.name: Evansburg State Park
activities.description: Evansburg State Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Collegeville, PA.

3241.directions: Fern Ave<br /><br />Collegeville Pa 19426<br /><br />If you turn on to Fern Ave from Ridge Pike, at the end of the road you will see a parking lot on your right. Park there. Trail head is on the other side of the road.

19626.name: Kiptopeke State Park

activities.name: Kiptopeke State Park
activities.description: Great hiking.

19626.directions: Located on the eastern shore of Virginia, this park offers recreational access to the Chesapeake Bay and the chance to explore a unique coastal habitat featuring a major flyway for migratory birds. Kiptopeke is three miles from the northern terminus of the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel, which has a substantial each-way toll charge, on Route 13. Turn west on Route 704; the park entrance is within a half mile. The park has an area for swimming Memorial Day to Labor Day.
19626.description: Since 1963, Kiptopeke has been the site of bird population studies. Sponsored by the Coastal Virginia Wildlife Observatory and licensed by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, volunteers capture, examine, weigh, band and release resident and migratory birds each year from mid-August through November. In the raptor research area, hawks, kestrels, osprey and other birds of prey are observed and banded from September through November. Kiptopeke's hawk observatory is among the top 15 nationwide.

23724.name: Woodrow Wilson Bridge Trail

activities.name: Woodrow Wilson Bridge Trail
activities.description: Excellent trails for hiking or jogging/running.

23724.directions: Oxon Hill Road across the Potomac River to the Huntington Metro Station in Virginia
23724.description: This 3.5-mile trail extends from Oxon Hill Road across the Potomac River to the Huntington Metro Station in Virginia. The trail connects to the network of trails in Northern Virginia, including the Mount Vernon Trail. The asphalt and concrete trail surface accommodates shared use for bicyclists, pedestrians, hikers, runners, and inline skaters and is completely separated from motor vehicle traffic. The trail has a rating of easy except for a difficult half-mile, uphill section to Oxon Hill Road from the Woodrow Wilson Bridge where the trail gains approximately 200 feet in elevation. To access the trail in Maryland, there are at-grade road crossings at Oxon Hill Road and National Harbor Boulevard. Expect expansion joints and unexpected dips on the Woodrow Wilson Bridge portion of the trail. NOTE: This trail over the Woodrow Wilson Bridge is closed during snowstorms due to plowing operations which might cause injury to trail users.

5135.name: Governor Dick

activities.name: Governor Dick
activities.description: Governor Dick features 9 miles of hiking trails near Mount Gretna, PA.

5135.directions: From RT117 Mount Gretna Turn left onto Pinch Road, go to top of hill and parking lot will be on your left. Also known as Horseshoe.

18949.name: Cherry Springs State Park

activities.name: Cherry Springs State Park
activities.description: The Cherry Springs Working Forest Interpretive Trail begins by the information kiosk and features wayside exhibits on forests and forestry practices.

18949.directions: Cherry Springs State Park in on PA 44 in Potter County.
18949.description: Cherry Springs State Park is nearly as remote and wild today as it was two centuries ago. Its dark skies make it a haven for astronomers. Named for the large stands of black cherry trees in the park, the 48-acre state park is surrounded by the 262,000-acre Susquehannock State Forest. The Susquehanna Trail passes nearby and offers 85 miles of backpacking and hiking.

19633.name: Pocahontas State Park

activities.name: Pocahontas State Park
activities.description: More than 52 miles of signed multi-use trails for bicycles and hikers, and the paved Spillway Trail for those with disabilities.

19633.directions: In Chesterfield County, about 20 miles from Richmond. It's easily accessible from Interstate 95, Route 288 and Route 360.
19633.description: Just 20 miles from downtown Richmond, Pocahontas offers boating, picnicking, camping, camping cabins, hiking, and interpretive and environmental education programs. The Aquatic Center offers seasonal water-based activities for the entire family. It has a kiddie pool, fountain wet deck, three-foot and five-foot-deep leisure pools, an activity pool and two tubular water slides. Rowboat, paddleboat, kayak and canoe rentals also are available at the 200-acre Swift Creek Lake during the summer. The park's two fishing lakes have crappie, largemouth bass, bluegill and catfish. The park has more than 80 miles of trails throughout 7,925 acres open to hiking, bicycling and horseback riding. The Civilian Conservation Corps Museum, dedicated to the Depression-era workers who helped build the state park system, is one of a handful in the nation. The park's Heritage Center is available for meetings, events and seasonal performances. Group facilities with meeting space and primitive overnight cabins also are available.

23592.name: Agricultural History Farm Park

activities.name: Agricultural History Farm Park
activities.description: Enjoy over 4 miles of natural surface hiking trails.

23592.description: The historic area takes visitors back to a typical early 20th century Montgomery County farm. This area includes the original farmhouse, bank barn and several outbuildings. Today's Montgomery County farming is supported by several federal, state and county agencies with offices in the Activity Center. These agencies assist the County's extensive farming community to increase agricultural production and conserve farmland for future generations.

23593.name: Black Hill Regional Park

activities.name: Black Hill Regional Park
activities.description: Scenic views of the lake and surrounding parkland can be enjoyed on over four miles of paved trails. Natural areas within the park can be explored on foot, mountain bike or horseback, on our more than 10 miles of natural surface trails.

23593.description: With more than 2,000 acres, Black Hill Regional Park offers such a wide variety of outdoor activities that it's impossible to experience it all in a single visit. You'll enjoy picnic shelters near playgrounds, volleyball courts, paved and natural surface trails, and spectacular views of Little Seneca Lake. The lake can be enjoyed from your private boat, our rental boats, our pontoon tour boat, and the fishing pier. For those who love the solitude of the forest, miles of trails can be explored by foot, horseback or mountain bike. Our nature programs and interpretive tours will enhance your understanding and appreciation of this beautiful park.

23595.name: Cabin John Regional Park

activities.name: Cabin John Regional Park
activities.description: Excellent hiking area.

23595.description: Enjoy a variety of sports facilities located within Cabin John Regional Park. Shirley Povich Field, one of several ball fields, is hoeme to the Bethesda Big Train team and the Georgetown University baseball team, and seats 750. Other sports facilities includie a lighted baseball rield, 5 softball fields (1 lighted), 4 lighted tennis practice walls, 9 lighted tennis courts, a pee-wee soccer field, 4 single wall handball courts and one volley court. Pee-Wee soccer field, softball and baseball fields require permits for use. For further information contact Park Permits Office

23596.name: Capital Crescent Trail Special Park

activities.name: Capital Crescent Trail Special Park
activities.description: Excellent hiking/jogging.

23596.directions: District Line to Bethesda Avenue<br />Bethesda, MD
23596.description: Capital Crescent Trail follows an abandoned railroad right of way and extends 11 miles from Georgetown, in the District of Columbia, to Silver Spring in Montgomery County. Approximately 5.5 miles of the trail are in Montgomery County.

19634.name: Sailor's Creek Battlefield Historic State Park

activities.name: Sailor
activities.description: There are two short hiking trails. One (.1 miles) leads to the battlefield monument. The Confederate Overlook Trail (.8 miles), which leads to Sailor's Creek, enables visitors to observe the Confederate position during the battle.

19634.directions: The park is at 6541 Saylers Creek Road, Rice, Va. From U.S. 460, take Route 617 (Saylers Creek Rd.) to Sailor's Creek Battlefield State Park. From U.S. 360, take State Route 307 (connecting highway between U.S. 360 and U.S. 460) to Route 617 North (Saylers Creek Rd.).
19634.description: On April 6, 1865, nearly a quarter of Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee's army, more than 7,700 men, were killed, wounded or captured here. Lee surrendered 72 hours later at Appomattox Court House. Costumed volunteers present various interpretive programs throughout the year. Living history events take place every April. Motorists traveling along Lee's Retreat can learn more about the battle by tuning their radios to AM 1610. For more information about seasonal tours of the Hillsman House, call 804-561-7510.

23599.name: Great Seneca Stream Valley Park

activities.name: Great Seneca Stream Valley Park
activities.description: Excellent hiking.

23599.directions: Frederick Rd Rt.355 to Watkins Mill Rd
23599.description: Of the nine sections (or "units") of Great Seneca Stream Valley Park, the largest is Unit #1, which stretches from Frederick Road (MD 355) north to Watkins Mill Road. Home of the Seneca Creek Greenway Trail, the park was acquired by M-NCPPC in several stages beginning in 1968.

23601.name: Hoyles Mill Conservation Park

activities.name: Hoyles Mill Conservation Park
activities.description: 6.3 miles of combined natural and hard surface trail.

23601.description: Hoyles Mill Conservation Park is a conservation area dedicated to environmental preservation. The park is undeveloped but provides opportunities for quiet enjoyment of the natural environment like the Hoyles Mill Village area of Germantown with open space. The park is home to Hoyles Mill Trail which travels south from Black Hill Regional Park (BHRP) through Boyds Local Park and Hoyles Mill Conservation Park to the South Germantown Recreation Park (SGRP) and into Seneca Creek State Park where it terminates at Schaeffer Farms in Seneca Creek State Park.

23603.name: Little Falls Stream Valley Park

activities.name: Little Falls Stream Valley Park
activities.description: Great trail.

23603.directions: From Macarthur Blvd. N. to River Rd.
23603.description: This park stretches from Fairfax Road (a few blocks south of Bradley Boulevard) at its northernmost point, to Macarthur Boulevard at its southernmost point. The park straddles Little Falls Parkway and the Capital Crescent Trail. The park features a playground and a picnic area. Most of the 160-acre park was acquired by M-NCPPC during the mid-1940s to the mid-1950s.

23604.name: Magruder Branch Stream Valley Park

activities.name: Magruder Branch Stream Valley Park
activities.description: This park comprises 173 acres along the Magruder Branch from Damascus Recreational Park south to Watkins Road. Primarily intended to conserve the environmentally-sensitive stream valley, the park is not developed for active recreation but welcomes visitors for such activities as hiking and birdwatching. Residents may also enjoy the Upper Magruder Stream Valley Park, which is located on the opposite (northern) side of Damascus Recreation Park.

23604.directions: Damascus Reg. Pk., N. to Damascus Blvd.<br />Damascus, MD 20872
23604.description: This park comprises 173 acres along the Magruder Branch from Damascus Recreational Park south to Watkins Road. Primarily intended to conserve the environmentally-sensitive stream valley, the park is not developed for active recreation but welcomes visitors for such activities as hiking and birdwatching. Residents may also enjoy the Upper Magruder Stream Valley Park, which is located on the opposite (northern) side of Damascus Recreation Park.

23609.name: Rachel Carson Conservation Park

activities.name: Rachel Carson Conservation Park
activities.description: This park honors America's outstanding writer, environmental activist, and County resident by conserving 650 acres in the Brookeville area of Montgomery County. Most of the park was acquired just after Ms. Carson's death in 1964, although there have been periodic acquisitions through 1990. Rachel Carson Conservation Park is a conservation area dedicated to environmental preservation. The park is undeveloped but provides opportunities for quiet enjoyment of the natural environment. One of the county's premier conservation areas, this Park has more than 6 miles of natural surface trails for hiking and equestrian use.

23609.description: This park honors America's outstanding writer, environmental activist, and County resident by conserving 650 acres in the Brookeville area of Montgomery County. Most of the park was acquired just after Ms. Carson's death in 1964, although there have been periodic acquisitions through 1990. Rachel Carson Conservation Park is a conservation area dedicated to environmental preservation. The park is undeveloped but provides opportunities for quiet enjoyment of the natural environment. One of the county's premier conservation areas, this Park has more than 6 miles of natural surface trails for hiking and equestrian use.

23610.name: Rock Creek Regional Park

activities.name: Rock Creek Regional Park
activities.description: Experience nature and wildlife while hiking over 13 miles of scenic trails at the park. Natural surface trails cover the Lake Needwood and Lake Frank areas.

23610.description: Rock Creek Regional Park covers approximately 1800 acres and includes the beautiful 75-acre Lake Needwood and the picturesque 55-acre Lake Frank. Visitors can enjoy the park by meandering along 13 miles of trails through woodlands and along the lakeshores, picnicking, fishing, boating and viewing many species of resident wildlife. Picnic shelters can be reserved by contacting the Park Permits Office. Other park amenities include playgrounds, Needwood Boat Rental and Snack Bar, Meadowside Nature Center and lake tours on the Queen Needwood.

23612.name: South Germantown Recreational Park

activities.name: South Germantown Recreational Park
activities.description: In the 1960s, M-NCPPC/Montgomery Parks began acquiring the land that is now South Germantown Recreational Park in order to preserve open space and provide parkland for residents in northern Montgomery County. Most of the park's 695 acres of rolling hills were once the James and Macie King Farm, a working dairy farm since the mid-1800s. The park's state-of-the-art facilities offer visitors a variety of leisure activities from which to choose, including hiking, biking, archery, miniature golf, swimming, soccer, picnicking, and adventure play, to name just a few. Facilities are still being added to accommodate residents' diverse interests.

23612.description: In the 1960s, M-NCPPC/Montgomery Parks began acquiring the land that is now South Germantown Recreational Park in order to preserve open space and provide parkland for residents in northern Montgomery County. Most of the park's 695 acres of rolling hills were once the James and Macie King Farm, a working dairy farm since the mid-1800s. The park's state-of-the-art facilities offer visitors a variety of leisure activities from which to choose, including hiking, biking, archery, miniature golf, swimming, soccer, picnicking, and adventure play, to name just a few. Facilities are still being added to accommodate residents' diverse interests.

23613.name: Wheaton Regional Park

activities.name: Wheaton Regional Park
activities.description: Excellent trails.

23613.description: Wheaton Regional Park is nestled in a forested area of Wheaton, Maryland. The park was established in 1960, incorporating several large parcels of land into one of Montgomery County's finest and largest parks. Visitors can enjoy a variety of recreational and educational opportunities within its 536 acres. Take a ride on the train, go horseback riding, have a picnic, go fishing, ice skate or play ball. Relax and tour Brookside Gardens' grounds and conservatory, attend a nature program, or traverse the trails and discover the park's beauty.

23614.name: Woodstock Equestrian Special Park

activities.name: Woodstock Equestrian Special Park
activities.description: Great trails.

23614.directions: On Rte. 28, 3/4 mile North of Beallsville Road/Route 109
23614.description: Woodstock Equestrian Park is located in the heart of the scenic Agricultural Reserve, just north of the historic town of Beallsville. The park features 872 acres of rolling farmland and forest, 16 miles of equestrian and hiking trails, three horse-friendly bridges, and two parking lots and entrances marked by monuments on each side of Route 28.

21568.name: Blue Marsh Lake

activities.name: Blue Marsh
activities.description: Blue Marsh features 30 miles of hiking trails near Reading, PA.

21568.directions: From Reading, approx. 5 miles northwest on PA 183 to Bern Church, then left following project signs to the lake.
21568.description: Blue Marsh Lake is a 6,100 acre-project having a 1,150-acre lake. Facilities include a day use area with swim beach, bathhouse, food concession, picnic areas, volleyball courts, pavilions available for rental; visitor center; three boat launches; and a stilling basin. Trails include a 30-mile multi-purpose hiking/biking trail and three interpretive trails, one being ADA accessible. Activities include swimming, picnicking, boating, water-skiing, hiking, equestrian and mountain bike riding, fishing, hunting, bird watching and other nature-oriented and outdoor activities.

3137.name: Big Pocono Game Lands

activities.name: Big Pocono Game Lands
activities.description: Big Pocono Game Lands features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tanneryville, PA.

3137.directions: Take the Tanneryville exit off Rt 80. follow signs to camelback ski resort.  drive up past resort.  on the right hand side is a gravel parking lot with a gate.  ride fire road up past the towers, then drop in.  This is a huge loop with the singletrack on the back side.

3139.name: Coal Cracker

activities.name: Coal Cracker
activities.description: Coal Cracker features 15 miles of hiking trails near Jim Thorpe, PA.

3139.directions: Park at Mauch Chunk Lake Park and head North to the Switchback Trail. Ask in downtown Jim Thorpe at Blue Mountain Bike Shop.

3140.name: Merli-Sarnoski

activities.name: Merli-Sarnoski
activities.description: Merli-Sarnoski features 10 miles of hiking trails near Carbondale, PA.

3140.directions: Off route 106 above Carbondale, Fell Twsp, Lackawanna Co, Pa.  Merli-Sarnoski County Park

3141.name: John Heinz Wildlife Preserve

activities.name: John Heinz Wildlife Preserve
activities.description: John Heinz Wildlife Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

3141.directions: From I -95 to Island Avenue travel away from airport (northwesterly) to Lindbergh Blvd. (go left) take to end. Cross 84th St/Hook Rd. John Heinz wildlife refuge on right.

15430.name: New Quarter Park

activities.name: New Quarter Park
activities.description: There are a series of small hiking trails and loops in the park.  The mountain bike trail offers approx. 6 miles of forested, blazed trails with expert areas for bikers.  The looped Hiking trails offer a couple view points and some historical information stands.

15430.directions: From I64: Take exit 242A (199W/Jamestown exit) Take rout 143, the first exit off 199.  Turn right on rout 143.  Take a right on Penniman Rd. (the first intersection, Magruder School is on the left).  Then take the first left onto Hubbard Ln. Continue until you pass the overpass, then make a right on Lakeshead Dr.  Follow this road to the park entrance.

3146.name: Brady's Run County Park

activities.name: Brady's Run County Park
activities.description: Brady's Run County Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near Beaver Falls, PA.

3146.directions: on Pa. turnpike heading towards Ohio get off at the Beaver Valley exit.  Best bet is to turn left off of exit  towards Beaver Falls and stop at gas station for directions.  If coming of Route 60 from Pittsburgh get off of last exit before toll road (beleive it is Chippewa exit).  At stop light at end of ramp take right and continue till a stop light, at the stop light take a right and park either in the dirt parking lot on the right (there is a large map there) or across the street in the ice rink parking lot.  Also, go to ClubMTB.com for directions if you cannot understand these or contact Denali Cycles in Bridgewater, Pa for directions and trail maps, weekly rides (great group of guys and girls) with all difficulty levels.

3255.name: Rattling Creek

activities.name: Rattling Creek
activities.description: Rattling Creek features 20 miles of hiking trails near Lykens, PA.

3255.directions: From http://rcst1.blogspot.com/2009/05/directions-to-rattling-creek-trails.html:<br /><br /><br /><br />The RCST trails are located in PA, approx. 25 miles North of Harrisburg.  If using a GPS, plug in the address 2800 White Oak Road, Halifax, Pennsylvania.  This will get you to the DCNR Buildings just as you enter the forest from the East end.  Camp Muckleratz is about 1/4 west of this address.  There's a sign, "Camp Muckleratz."

3149.name: Geisinger Trails

activities.name: Geisinger Trails
activities.description: Geisinger Trails features 5 miles of hiking trails near Danville, PA.

3149.directions: From route 11 in Danville turn by Dunkin' Donuts.  Go through next light and up towards Geisinger hospital.  Stay on that road all the way around hospital.  When coming back onto main road make a right.  Take the next left that isnt to a parking lot.  Approx. 1/5 miles to 4X4 road.  You will see parking near there.  Trailheads located there or further past to Yellow marked trail on right.  Also, you can skip the left and go approx. 1/2 mile up main road to Red marked trail.

3150.name: Lehigh Mountain

activities.name: Lehigh Mountain
activities.description: Lehigh Mountain features 10 miles of hiking trails near Bethlehem, PA.

3150.directions: 378 South into Bethlehem.  Follow 378 until you see Puggy Dr. on your right, take this and loop around to the left as you cannot make the left at the light.  After crossing the light you will be going up Mtn Dr.  Take the road on the right across from the TV station (channel 39 PBS I believe) and park in the uppoer lot.  There are trails all over.

3151.name: Prompton State Park

activities.name: Prompton St Park
activities.description: Prompton St Park features 25 miles of hiking trails near Honesdale, PA.

3151.directions: take rt 6 west from honesdale to rt 170 right turn there go 1/ 2 mile to parking lot on the right.also coming from waymart head east on rt 6 to rt 170 left turn then 1/2 mile to parking lot.
3151.description: Prompton State Park contains the 290-acre Prompton Lake. Activities such as hiking, mountain biking, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing and sledding are available here for visitors.

3153.name: Airfield

activities.name: Airfield
activities.description: Airfield features 2 miles of hiking trails near Reading, PA.

3153.directions: From NY/NJ Area: 78 West to 61 South to 222 South. Take the Penn Street exit to Perkiomen Avenue.

3154.name: Great Allegheny Passage

activities.name: Great Allegheny Passage
activities.description: Great Allegheny Passage features 100 miles of hiking trails near Mckeesport, PA.

3154.directions: from <br /><br />pa<br /><br /> turnpike monroeville exit take rt.48 to boston trail head under bridge rt turn at bridge then one more rt.

15443.name: Ronald C. McDonnell Campground Loop

activities.name: Ronald C. McDonnell Campground Loop
activities.description: Ronald C. McDonnell Campground Loop is a 3 mile hiking trail in Bethesda, Maryland.

15443.directions: Two options for parking.  Either make your way to the end of Goya Drive and park there (not a lot of room and residents have a basketball hoop set up there) or park in the Cabin John Park lots and ride your way up to the trail head, which is located off Tortilla Trail.  <br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br />11800 Goya Dr, Potomac, MD 20854<br /><br /><br /><br />Cabin John Parks:  39.03417,-77.148111

3160.name: R.b. Winter State Park

activities.name: Raymond B. Winter State Park
activities.description: Raymond B. Winter State Park features 35 miles of hiking trails near Mifflingburg/lewisburg, PA.

3160.directions: From U.S. 15 in Lewisburg take PA 192 West for about 18 miles. There a couple of places to park. <br /><br />Not all of the trials allow biking so pick up a trail map at the trail head.

3161.name: Roaring Creek Watershed

activities.name: Roaring Creek Watershed
activities.description: Roaring Creek Watershed features 16 miles of hiking trails near Elysburg, PA.

3161.directions: From I-80 West of Bloomsburg take exit 224 (the Danville Exit) get onto PA 54 East toward Danville.  Go straight thru Danville and follow PA 54 thru Elysburg. You will enter a noticeably more wooded and mountainous area. The Trail head will be on your left almost right across the road from Aqua Pennsylvania. <br /><br />From Bloomsburg, PA and points East on I-80 you would take PA 487 south to Elysburg and catch PA 54 East there. <br /><br /><br />From Sunbury take PA 61 to PA 487 toward Elysburg then get on PA 54 <br /><br />There is a trail head at the other end on PA 42 as well. <br /><br />This trail is part of The Wyoming State Forest. If you have any questions I'm sure these guys can help:<br /><br /><br />Bureau of Forestry<br />Forest District #20<br /><br />274 Arbutus Park Rd<br />Bloomsburg, PA 17815<br />(570) 387-4255

3162.name: Lehigh Gorge Trail

activities.name: Lehigh Gorge Trail
activities.description: Lehigh Gorge Trail features 25 miles of hiking trails near Jim Thorpe, PA.

3162.directions: Go north on PA-903 out of Jim Thorpe and cross the Lehigh River.  There is a sharp left turn right after the bridge.  After this when 903 turns right go straight  until you see the Glen Onoko access road. Turn left to go to the trail head. It a little back the access road until you get to the end by Glen Onoko Falls.

3163.name: Stony Valley Trail

activities.name: Stony Valley Trail
activities.description: Stony Valley Trail features 28 miles of hiking trails near Dauphin/harrisburg, PA.

3163.directions: Take US-322 West out of Harrisburg and exit onto PA-225. Turn left onto Erie Street then right on Susquehanna Ave. Go about 4 and half miles and get onto Stony Creek Valley Road to the trailhead.

3164.name: Broad Mt. Loop

activities.name: Broad Mt. Loop
activities.description: Broad Mt. Loop features 10 miles of hiking trails near Jim Thorpe, PA.

3164.directions: From downtown Jim Thorpe take 209S to 93N proceed up the hill just over 3 miles.  At the top of this hill will be a parking area on the right hand side.  Park here and proceed down the forest road on the righthand side of the parking area.

3258.name: Nockamixon State Park

activities.name: Nockamixon State Park
activities.description: Nockamixon State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Ottsville, PA.

3258.directions: From 611 & 113, Head North on 611<br /><br />After about 3 miles, turn Left onto Tower Road<br /><br />Follow Tower Road until it forms an elbow with Fink Drive - parking lot is at the corner

3166.name: Allegrippis Trails

activities.name: Allegrippis Trails
activities.description: Allegrippis Trails features 30 miles of hiking trails near Raystown Lake, PA.

3166.directions: You can access the Allegrippis Trails at trailheads along Seven Points Road just past the Seven Points Entrance Station and on Bakers Hollow Road just before the Susquehannock Campground Entrance Station.

3170.name: French Creek State Park

activities.name: French Creek
activities.description: There are 9 trials to choose from in the French Creek State Park. The smallest is the Kalmia Trail measuring in at one mile and the longest is the Horse-shoe trail measuring in at eight miles.

3170.directions: French Creek State Park can be reached from PA 345 south of Birdsboro, north of PA 23, and from the Morgantown exits (1A and 1 B) of the PA Turnpike.
3170.description: French Creek State Park is made up of forests, lakes, wetlands and fields. This 7,730-acre park boasts a variety of activities to keep you busy. Biking, hiking, swimming, boating, fishing, and sledding are but a few of the many activities here.

15460.name: Seneca Bluffs Trail

activities.name: Seneca Bluffs Trail
activities.description: Seneca Bluffs Trail is a 4 mile hiking trail in Darnestown, Maryland.

15460.directions: There are two parking lots available with ready access to this trail, and awesomely enough, one is at each end of the trail.  Easiest  method is making your way to Rt28 and finding the park parking lot near Great Seneca Creek.  The southern lot is off Montevideo Road, near Rocklands Farm.  GPS coordinates for both lots are below.<br /><br /><br /><br />North Lot: 39.128204,-77.333066<br /><br />South Lot: 39.091025,-77.343848<br /><br /><br /><br />Only at the southern lot is the trail located where you park.  If you go to the north lot, you will need to ride a short distance on Rt18 in the westbound direction and look for the trail head on the other side of the creek.  Trailhead will be on your left as you are heading west.  It is a wide path, so it is easy to spot.

3173.name: Jacobsburg Park

activities.name: Jacobsburg Park
activities.description: Jacobsburg Park features 0 miles of hiking trails near Nazareth, PA.

3173.directions: From Allentown/Bethlehem, PA<br /><br />Take 22E to the Rt. 191 Nazareth Pike exit.  Make a left at the end of the off ramp.  Take 191 to the light at Easton Rd (Pass the Nazareth Speedway on left).  Make a left onto S Broad St (2nd light).  Follow S Broad until you see Jacobsburg Rd on your right (at the top of a slight hill).  Make that right onto Jacobsburg Rd and follow.  At fork in the road keep right onto Belfast Rd.  Look for parking lot on the right.

3177.name: Michaux State Forest

activities.name: Michaux State Forest
activities.description: Michaux State Forest features 20 miles of hiking trails near Chambersburg, PA.

3177.directions: Take Route 30 east from Chambersburg or west from Gettysburg.  Take 233 north (Pine Grove Road) at a traffic light.  After about 2 miles take a left onto Shippensburg Road.  Drive up the hill and there will be a snowmobile trail lot on the left (about 1.5 miles).  Park and hit the trail.  I usually ride down the fire road, take a left onto the powerline trail, then hang a right onto a great downhill trail.

3187.name: Wissahickon Valley Park

activities.name: Wissahickon Valley Park
activities.description: Wissahickon Valley Park features 14 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

3187.directions: Many access points in Philadelphia: Northwest Ave, Valley Green Road... Be careful parking in remote spots and take all of your valuables because theft is a real issue in parts of Faimount Park

3189.name: Oakbourne Park

activities.name: Oakbourne Park
activities.description: Oakbourne Park features 3 miles of hiking trails near West Chester, PA.

3189.directions: Closest Intersection is South Concord Road and Pleasant Grove Road in West Chester (Westtown Township).  Two parking areas, one accessible from each of the roads bounding the park.<br /><br />From the South: Take Rte. 202 North.  Cross 926.  Turn left onto Pleasant Grove Road.  Just under one mile, parking area on the left.<br /><br />From the North:  Take 202 South to Matlack Street exit.  Turn left at the light onto Matlack.  After one mile, rear right at the Y-intersection onto South Concord Road.  Â¼-mile to park entrance on the right.  Follow park access road up the hill to the mansion.  Parking lots alongside and behind the mansion.

3190.name: Valley Forge Park River Trail

activities.name: Valley Forge Park River Trail
activities.description: Valley Forge Park River Trail features 8 miles of hiking trails near Audubon, PA.

3190.directions: From King of Prussia, PA  -  Take Rte. 422 west approximately 3 miles.  Exit at Rte.363, Audubon/Trooper.  Stay left on the ramp, then turn left at the top of the ramp.  Â¼-mile to park entrance on right  -  that is the Valley Forge / Betzwood Bridge Park.<br /><br />Drive to the far end of the parking lot. Traihead is in the cul-de-sac.

3192.name: Marsh Creek Park

activities.name: Marsh Creek Park
activities.description: Marsh Creek Park features 12 miles of hiking trails near Eagle, PA.

3192.directions: From highway 282 (Creek Road), turn onto N. Reed Road (about 5 miles north of Downingtown).  Follow Reed Road to Marsh Creek State Park entrance and park in lot alongside lake.  Enter trails behind, and to the right of the restroom facility -or- go in opposite direction to the end of the parking lot and follow trail around the lake and past farms on paved trail (dirt trail will be on left after about 1.5 miles).

3193.name: Belmont Plateau

activities.name: Belmont Plateau
activities.description: Belmont Plateau features 0 miles of hiking trails near Philadelphia, PA.

3193.directions: Driving Directions to Belmont Plateau<br />Exit I-76 at Exit 341 - Montgomery Drive.<br />Make Right onto Montgomery Drive and proceed up hill, go under I-76 and then make your first <br />right into the park, it should be obvious, there is a lot as soon as you turn in or you can park at <br />the trailhead down the road on the right.<br /><br />

3194.name: Bonner Park

activities.name: Bonner Park
activities.description: Bonner Park features 4 miles of hiking trails near Glen Mills, PA.

3194.directions: From Rte. 926 between West Chester and Rte. 352, turn south down Cheyney road toward Cheyney University.  At the end of the college campus, turn left onto Creek Road.  At the first stop sign, turn right to stay on Creek Road.   Chester Creek will be on your right.  Look for Locksley Road bridge less than a half mile from the stop sign.  Park at any road side pull-off and ride back to Locksley Road.  Cross over the bridge, and the trail will be on both sides of the road.

21629.name: Cowanesque Lake

activities.name: Cowanesque Lake
activities.description: Trails available at Cowanesque Lake, South Shore, and Tompkins Campground areas.

21629.directions: Located near Lawrenceville, PA, just below the New York state line, off US Route 15 and between PA Route 49 and County Route 58052.
21629.description: This Corps project located near the New York state line in North Central Pennsylvania provides a 1,085-acre lake with 17 miles of shoreline for use by campers and day trippers.

21630.name: Crooked Creek Lake

activities.name: Crooked Creek Lake
activities.description: Hiking trails at Beach, Boat Launch Area, and Outflow Area.

21630.directions: From Kittanning, 7 miles south on PA 66.
21630.description: Crooked Creek Rangers developed the Corps' first Auto Tour Trail. The trail takes in the local history of Armstrong County and local townships. Visitors are provided information on the one room schools of 1867, the first water-powered sawmill and depreciation lands awarded soldiers of the American Revolutionary War. The trail was the combined effort of the Rangers and local historians.

3199.name: East Bradford (Harmony Hill) Recreation Area

activities.name: East Bradford (Harmony Hill) Recreation Area
activities.description: East Bradford (Harmony Hill) Recreation Area features 4 miles of hiking trails near Downingtown, PA.

3199.directions: From Rte. 30 & Quarry road in east Downingtown (BJ\'s shopping center):<br />South on Quarry Road, 1 mile to Boot Road.<br />Turn right at light, west on Boot Road, go 2.25 miles.<br />Turn left, south on Skelp Level Road, go 1 mile to Wilderness Trail.   Access Road is 0.1 mile past Wilderness Trail on the right.  It is poorly marked, and hidden in roadside foliage.   Look for brown farm gate.

3200.name: High Rocks

activities.name: High Rocks
activities.description: High Rocks features 10 miles of hiking trails near Tinicum, PA.

3200.directions: From Doylestown take 611 N until Dark Hallow RD. Turn Right. Follow Dark Hallow RD until Stover Park RD, turn right onto Sover Park Rd. Then make next left onto Tory RD and park on the left. OR(recommended) keep following Tory Rd and make a right onto Cafferty RD and park at Tohickon Valley Park.

3202.name: Moraine State Park

activities.name: Moraine State Park
activities.description: Moraine State Park is a whopping 16,725 acre park that attracts over a million people each year. There is a vast amount of activities to do there including hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, sledding, snowmobiling and of course, camping. The hiking trails here vary from easy to difficult and all six of them add up to a grand total of 28 miles.

3202.directions: Take I79 to 422 exit, travel east on 422 to the south shore exit. Make a U turn and <br />follow directions to north shore exit. Take north shore exit to north shore drive to <br />marina, turn left on Mt Union road, trailhead is on your right at the start of a <br />pipeline.
3202.description: Moraine State Park is a whopping 16,725 acre park that attracts over a million people each year. There is a vast amount of activities to do there including hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, sledding, snowmobiling and of course, camping.

activities.name: Bavington
activities.description: Bavington features 13 miles of hiking trails near Pittsburgh, PA.

3206.name: Nottingham County Park

activities.name: Nottingham County Park
activities.description: Nottingham County Park features 18 miles of hiking trails near Nottingham, PA.

3206.directions: 150 Park Road, Nottingham, PA 19362<br /><br />From Rte 1, just above the PA/MD border, take the exit for Nottingham, Rte. 272.<br />At the top of the ramp, follow the park signs.  About 2 miles to the park.

3207.name: Liberty Twp State Game Lands

activities.name: Liberty Twp State Game Lands
activities.description: Liberty Twp State Game Lands features 20 miles of hiking trails near Danville, PA.

3207.directions: From the intersection of PA54 and US11 in Danville, travel west on 11 toward Sunbury. Take soft right up the mountain onto Baldtop Rd just as you\\\'re leaving Danville (past the VFW). Follow Baldtop for several miles until you pass a CATV outpost. Look for the sign to the State Game Lands on the left about a quarter mile past the outpost.

1160.name: Iron Hill Rec Area

activities.name: Iron Hill Rec Area
activities.description: Iron Hill Rec Area is a 8 mile hiking trail in Newark, Delaware.

1160.directions: Off of I-95 North, Exit 1A, Make a right at first light.  Pass the Iron Hill Museum (on your right), and make the next right.  This will take you to Iron Hill Park--park anywhere and jump on the various trails.

15497.name: Bull Run Mountain Conservancy

activities.name: Bull Run Mountain Conservancy
activities.description: Wandering trails through the Thoroughfare Gap area around Bull run Mountain.  Sights such as an old stone mill, cemetery and civil war era ruins scattered in the woods.  Water is plentiful.  No pets, open to the public.

15497.directions: I-66 to Haymarket, Rt 55 to Rt 723 on right.  Left on Beverly Mill Drive. Follow to the end, parking on left, trailhead on right.

1162.name: Brandywine State Park

activities.name: Brandywine Creek State Park
activities.description: Brandywine Creek State Park features 15 miles of hiking trails near Wilmington, DE.

1162.directions: From Delaware take 95 north to 202 north make a left at Damons restraunt park in the Jewish center parking lot trail head starts in the tree\'s....

1163.name: Middle Run Natural Area

activities.name: Middle Run Natural Area
activities.description: Middle Run Natural Area features 10 miles of hiking trails near Newark, DE.

1163.directions: Take Exit 1 off I-95 at stop sign make a Left onto DE-896(College Ave.) toward Newark. Make a right at Chestnut Hill Road intersection there are signs to follow DE-2 East, DE-72, and DE-4. You will go past the UD football stadium. Make a Left onto DE-2/DE-72. Follow DE-2 East as it becomes Capitol Trail. Make a Left on DE-72 /Possum Park Road. Follow this until you can make a left on Possum Hollow Rd.<br />You will see signs for the Park on your Left, turn in and follow to the end to park. There is a detailed map up Middle Run here, the map of White Clay Creek State Park shows the trails but does not name them.

3212.name: Sugarloaf Mountain Bike Area

activities.name: Sugarloaf Mountain Bike Area
activities.description: Sugarloaf Mountain Bike Area features 9 miles of hiking trails near Ohiopyle, PA.

3212.directions: Route 381 runs right through Ohiopyle.  Sugarloaf Road is opposite the boat launch area, right next to the Boater\\\'s Change House.  If you go over a bridge (in either direction) you\\\'ve gone too far.  The Mountain Bike Area is a few miles out of town, on the right.  If you pass the little chapel and cemetery, you\\\'ve gone too far.

1166.name: White Clay Creek

activities.name: White Clay Creek
activities.description: 24 mile hiking trail located near Newark, Delaware

1166.directions: White Clay Creek State Park, DE.

1167.name: Swamp Forest Trail (lums Pond State Park)

activities.name: Swamp Forest Trail (lums Pond State Park)
activities.description: Swamp Forest Trail (lums Pond State Park) features 7 miles of hiking trails near Bear, DE.

1167.directions: (Directions from the website)<br /><br /><br /><br />From points North<br /><br /><br /><br />    * ROUTE 95 SOUTH TO EXIT 1 A (MIDDLETOWN)<br /><br />    * TAKE ROUTE 896 SOUTH, 6 MILES<br /><br />    * MAKE LEFT TURN ON HOWELL SCHOOL ROAD<br /><br />    * THE PARK ENTRANCE IS ON TERIGHT, 1/4 MILE<br /><br /><br /><br />From points South<br /><br /><br /><br />    * ROUTE 13 NORTH<br /><br />    * MAK A LEFT AT ROUTE 896 301 JUNCTION (ALS KNOWN AS BOYD'S CORNER)<br /><br />    * CROSS THE SUMMIT BRIDGE (IT GOES OVER T C & D CANAL)<br /><br />    * MAKE A RIGHT ON HOWELL SCHOOL ROAD<br /><br />    * THE PARK ENTRANCE IS ON THE RIGHT, 1/4 MILE<br /><br />

3217.name: Pohopoco Tract

activities.name: Pohopoco Tract
activities.description: Pohopoco Tract features 7 miles of hiking trails near Albrightsville, PA.

3217.directions: From the town of Blakeslee travel south on highway 115 approximately 6 miles. Access road will be on right. Travel several hundred yards and parking area will be on left.

3218.name: Seven Springs

activities.name: Seven Springs
activities.description: Seven Springs features 0 miles of hiking trails near Somerset, PA.

3218.directions: From anywhere between Somerset and Donegal on State Highway 31, follow the signs to Seven Springs Mountain Resort.

3219.name: Okehocking Preserve

activities.name: Okehocking Preserve
activities.description: Okehocking Preserve features 5 miles of hiking trails near West Chester, PA.

3219.directions: 5316 West Chester Pike, Newtown Square, PA 19073<br /><br />From the center of West Chester, go east on Rt 3 (6.5 miles), past 352, past 926, do a U-turn at Delchester road. Parking is on your next right, and it looks like a driveway. Don't use the private drive adjacent to parking.

3220.name: Idlewood
