19014.directions: From US 322, near the top of Seven Mountains, follow signs for Poe Valley State Park. On Big Poe Road, continue past Poe Valley State Park for three miles to Poe Paddy State Park.<br /><br />From Millheim, go west on PA 45 for 1.5 miles, then follow signs south for 12 miles to the park.
19014.description: Poe Paddy State Park is a fisherman's paradise as it is located at the convergence of Big Poe Creek and Penns Creek. It also has hiking, snowmobiling and camping to offer visitors to enjoy.

5545.name: Osceola National Forest -Trails

activities.name: Osceola National Forest -Trails
activities.description: The Florida Trail starts at Olustee State Park to Deep Creek.  There are a number of campsites along this beautiful scenic trail through the pine and cypress forests.

5545.directions: West of Jacksonville, N. of Gainesville and East of Lake City Florida.  The Osceola National Forest has a variety of hiking trails through the Gum Swamp Wilderness, Olustee Battlefield, Red Cockaded Woodpecker habitat and the Florida Trail.  There are also multiple equestrian trails located at West Tower.

2631.name: Wawayand State Park

activities.name: Waywayanda State Park
activities.description: Waywayanda State Park features 20 miles of hiking trails near Warwick, NJ.

2631.directions: Directions :  From New Jersey, Wayne area,, rte 46, rte 80,, take rte 23 North bound,, all the way into West Milford, keep going until you get to a light at rte 94. Make a right and keep going. You will see signs for Mountain Creek,, a ski resort. Follow these signs, you will pass this resort. <br /><br />Anyway,, just keep going on 94, it will bend around, and go through another light or so.Finally,it will come to a light with a Mobil on the right, you just passed a Dunkin Donuts on your left too. Make a left there,, rte 94 keeps to the left. Follow again,, about 3 miles or so,, you will enter New York State. Close after that,, you will see Pennings Apple Orchard,, make a right after that,, there is a shopping center too. Keep going up that hill  1 - 2 miles,until you see the park entrance on your right. From Wayne area this drive is approx 40 minutes. Drive into the park,, ranger station is on the right. You can park there.  Have a great ride.

19698.name: Lost River State Park

activities.name: Lost River State Park
activities.description: Several miles of hiking trails lead to hours of exercise and an unparalleled opportunity for nature study given the abundance of flora and fauna found in the park.   One rewarding trail leads to Cranny Crow overlook with its commanding views of the park from 3,200 feet.

19698.directions: Lost River State Park is located in Hardy County in West Virginia's eastern panhandle, ten miles north of the Virginia State line and 23 miles south of Wardensville, WV. Turn west off of WV 259 at Mathias, then follow the secondary road for four miles to the park entrance.
19698.description: Nestled in the wooded mountains of Hardy County, Lost River State Park encompasses 3,712 acres creating a vacation getaway.

11694.name: Gifford Pinchot State Park

activities.name: Gifford Pinchot State Park
activities.description: Gifford Pinchot State Park is a full service park with with the 340-acre  Pinchot Lake as the main feature. There are 18 hiking trails with red blazes to help guide you along the way. The longest trail is the Mason-Dixon Trail which is 200 miles and runs through multiple states. The shortest is the Oak Trail at 0.4 miles.

11694.directions: Gifford Pinchot State Park is reached from Harrisburg via the Lewisberry Exit (35) of I-83 south, then PA 177 south; or by US 15 south to Dillsburg, then to PA 74 south. From York, take PA 74 north or I-83 north. From I-83, take the Newberrytown Exit (32), PA 382 west to PA 177 south.
11694.description: Gifford Pinchot State Park is a full service park with with the 340-acre  Pinchot Lake as the main feature. This park is 2, 338 acres and boasts activities including hiking, biking, swimming, boating, fishing and camping.

28573.name: Bayard Conservation Area

activities.name: Bayard Conservation Area
activities.description: This conservation area's importance is magnified by its closeness to the St. Johns River and the Jacksonville metropolitan area. It is a key to providing flood storage and preservation of water and natural resources in the Lower St. Johns River Basin. Riverine bottomland hardwoods, pine flatwoods and sandhill communities are bordered on the east by the St. Johns River with approximately seven miles of river frontage.

28573.directions: Two parking areas are located on the south side of SR 16. The western parking area is recommended for horseback riding enthusiasts. Other access points are located off U.S. 17 and County Road 226, three miles south of Green Cove Springs.

25160.name: West Essex Trail

activities.name: West Essex Trail
activities.description: The trail is situated on the former right-of-way of the Caldwell Branch of the old Erie-Lackawanna Railroad.  Acquired in 1985 through Green Acre funding, the 2.84 mile trail runs from Arnold Way in Verona, northeast to the Passaic County line. It crosses over Route 23 and the Peckman River and passes along Cedar Grove Community Park. The primary access to the trail is from Fairview Avenue, near Verona High School.

25160.directions: Take Route 280 to Exit 7/Pleasant Valley Way. Turn right onto Pleasant Valley Way. Turn left onto Bloomfield Avenue. Turn right onto Fairview Avenue. The Trail crosses Fairview Avenue at Verona High School.
25160.description: The trail is situated on the former right-of-way of the Caldwell Branch of the old Erie-Lackawanna Railroad.  Acquired in 1985 through Green Acre funding, the 2.84 mile trail runs from Arnold Way in Verona, northeast to the Passaic County line. It crosses over Route 23 and the Peckman River and passes along Cedar Grove Community Park. The primary access to the trail is from Fairview Avenue, near Verona High School.

19018.name: Prince Gallitzin State Park

activities.name: Prince Gallitzin State Park
activities.description: Prince Gallitzin State Park contains the 1,635-acre Glendale Lakewith it's 26 miles of shoreline. It's recreational activities include hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, and snowmobiling. There is also camping available in order to have time to enjoy everything! The trails here vary in views and most pass near the lake at one point or another.

19018.directions: Prince Gallitzin State Park can be reached by PA 36 and 53 and US 22 and 219. From US 219, at Carrolltown, turn onto SR 4015. At Patton, take US 36 east to Glendale Lake Road. From US 22, Cresson Exit, follow PA 53 north.<br /><br />From PA 53, turn at either Frugality or Flinton. At Frugality, following State Park Drive/Marina Road will take you into the major day use areas of the park. From Flinton, Beaver Valley Road will also take you into the park and is a more direct route to the campground.<br /><br />From I-99, Exit 32, follow PA 36 west, turn right at Ashville onto PA 53 north.
19018.description: Prince Gallitzin State Park contains the 1,635-acre Glendale Lakewith it's 26 miles of shoreline. It's recreational activities include hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, swimming, boating, fishing, cross-country skiing, and snowmobiling. There is also camping available in order to have time to enjoy everything!

5567.name: La-Ho Trail

activities.name: La-Ho Trail
activities.description: Water side hike for almost the entire hike. A few hills, but nothing too bad.

5567.directions: on 216 east, make right to trailhead just over the second bridge

5570.name: Sky Meadows State Park

activities.name: Sky Meadows State Park
activities.description: Several interconnected hiking trails of slight to moderate difficulty.  Terrain ranges from light forest to open meadow.  There is a historical building and bathroom next to the parking lot.

5570.directions: About 7 miles north of I-66 up US-17 / VA-55 on the left.  There is a small fee to park or camp in the area.

21960.name: Kresson Park

activities.name: Kresson Park
activities.description: 3 mile hiking trail located near Cherry Hill, New Jersey

21960.directions: Off Springdale and Kresson Road Cherry Hill

7630.name: Fort Frederick State Park

activities.name: Fort Frederick State Park
activities.description:
Fort Frederick State Park is a 585-acre area that features the stone fort that served as Maryland's frontier defense during the French and Indian War. The park is full of history and provides programs that cover gun use, junior ranger, colonial children's day and the 18th Century Market Fair.

A boat launch provides easy water access for fishing and swimming use. A hiking trail and interpretive programs provide a valuable culturing experience. The park has several picnic areas, campsites, a playground and more amenities for a variety of other recreational activities.

Hiking is a pleasure at the park's short .3 miles trail that passes through the wetlands. Hikers will have to the opportunity to see a variety of wildlife including turtles, waterfowl and deer.

7630.directions: Fort Frederick State Park is located in the Cumberland Valley, 18 miles west of Hagerstown and one mile south of I-70 near Big Pool (Rt. 56, Exit 12). The park is 88 miles from Baltimore and 81 miles from Washington, D.C.
7630.description:
Fort Frederick State Park is a 585-acre area that features the stone fort that served as Maryland's frontier defense during the French and Indian War. The park is full of history and provides programs that cover gun use, junior ranger, colonial children's day and the 18th Century Market Fair. 

A boat launch provides easy water access for fishing and swimming use. A hiking trail and interpretive programs provide a valuable culturing experience. The park has several picnic areas, campsites, a playground and more amenities for a variety of other recreational activities.

19021.name: Prouty Place State Park

activities.name: Prouty Place State Park
activities.description: Prouty Place State Park is located in Galeton, PA and is surrounded by the Susquehannock State Forest. It gives access to fishing and hiking to visitors. Trailheads here lead into the Susquehannock State Forest.

19021.directions: Prouty Place State Park is five miles southwest of PA 44 along Long Toe Road.
19021.description: Prouty Place State Park is located in Galeton, PA and is surrounded by the Susquehannock State Forest. It gives access to fishing and hiking to visitors.

5584.name: Canada Goose Trail

activities.name: Canada Goose Trail
activities.description: Although many of the local Wildlife Refuges have various hiking trails, this is one of the few that is more than five miles.  This trail (which is open to automobiles in the autumn) travels along the Des Lacs Valley.

5584.directions: From US 52, travel about one mile west on County Highway 2 (6th Street NW).  The trail begins on the north side of the road.  Park at the southern end of the trail off to the side.

17874.name: Long Branch State Park

activities.name: Long Branch State Park
activities.description: Three hiking trails allow you to explore the park.

17874.description: Looking for a place to get a watersports fix? Long Branch State Park's three boat ramps provide access to sprawling and picturesque Long Branch Lake. Want to get some fishing in? The park offers some of the best bass fishing in northern Missouri and its swimming beach a is a favorite for families. More than 80 campsites make the park a perfect place for overnight stays. And the park's native prairie offers peaceful hiking opportunities.

5591.name: Royalston Falls

activities.name: Royalston Falls
activities.description: Woodsy walk,but the highlight is the Falls. They are spectacular!!

5591.directions: From Worcester Ma: 290 to 190N to 2W From Rt. 2, take Exit 18, Rt. 2A West. Follow into Athol. At the intersection of Rts. 2A and 32 in Athol, cross Millers River Bridge and bear right onto Chestnut Hill Rd. (becomes Athol Rd.) north toward Royalston. From Royalston Center, follow Rt. 68 North until it ends. Turn right onto Rt. 32 North and follow for 1.7 mi. to entrance on right. Enter the reservation via the marked Tully Trail.

2640.name: Allamuchy State Park-North

activities.name: Allamuchy State Park-North
activities.description: Allamuchy State Park-North features 4 miles of hiking trails near Hackettstown, NJ.

2640.directions: Route 80 West to exit for Route 206 North.  Follow signs to Waterloo Village.<br />Parking Lot is across the street on County Road 604 (Waterloo Road) before<br />making the left to Waterloo Village.

5605.name: Dukes Creek Falls

activities.name: Dukes Creek Falls
activities.description: Duke Creek Falls Trail features several beautiful cascades that can be viewed near or far. The main attraction to the area is its 300ft falls from Davis Creek into the Dukes Creek Gorge...AMAZING! :-)

5605.directions: Take GA 75-N from Helen for 1.5 miles. Turn left on GA 356 (Alt. 75) and go 2.3 miles to the Richard Russell Scenic Byway. Turn right and go 2 miles to the Dukes Creek Falls Recreation Area.

19708.name: Stonewall Resort

activities.name: Stonewall Resort
activities.description: Great hiking.

19708.directions: From Pittsburgh, PA: Take I-79 south to Washington. Take the left fork to I-79 South at Washington and merge onto I-79 S. Take the exit onto I-70 E/I-79 toward New Stanton/Morgantown. Merge onto I-79 S via exit 21 to Morgantown. Follow I-79 south to exit 91 US-19 to Roanoke.  Turn right on US-19 South and follow the signs to Stonewall Resort State Park.  Our entrance will be on your left, approximately 2.5 miles from the interstate.
19708.description: Welcome to a lakeside resort that combines the rustic charm of Adirondack-style lodges of the 1920s with the best technology, amenities and recreational choices of today. Each of our well-appointed guestrooms, suites and cottages has a view of Stonewall Jackson Lake, the award-winning Arnold Palmer Signature golf course or adjacent woodlands.

21995.name: O Leno State Park (Florida)

activities.name: O Leno State Park
activities.description: The 6000-acre park is known for its networks of hiking trails and waterways. ...O'Leno State Park is located along the banks of the Santa Fe River, the park features sinkholes, hardwood hammocks, river swamps, and sandhills. This park is one of Florida's first state parks, O'Leno was first developed by the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) in the 1930s. The suspension bridge was built by the CCC  Visitors  Canoes and bicycles are available for rent. Several hiking trails are available within the park. Located on U.S. 441, six miles north of High Springs.

21995.directions: 410 SE Oleno Park Rd  High Springs, FL 32643<br /><br />(386) 454-4201

5620.name: Zaleski Backpack Trail

activities.name: Zaleski Backpack Trail
activities.description: The Zaleski State Forest is the second largest forest in the system. The main trail is a loop of 23.5 miles. There is also a 10-mile day loop trail

5620.directions: On State Route 278 near Lake Hope. The trailhead is near the old iron furnace

22006.name: Liberty Cap

activities.name: Liberty Cap
activities.description: From the eastern entrance you'll climb 2 miles to the Liberty Cap formation.  The trail is rocky and steep; it is not one for the faint-of-heart! Round trip from the east entrance to the formation is 4 miles.  If you enter from the Monument you'll have a longer hike but with less elevation gain/loss.

22006.directions: To reach the eastern trailhead follow Hwy 340 west to Redlands Parkway.  Turn left and follow S. Broadway past Meadows Way.  Turn left at the next road, Wildwood Drive and follow this around to the trailhead.  There should be signs.  The upper entrance to Liberty Cap is located in the Colorado National Monument.

16295.name: Three Island Crossing State Park

activities.name: Three Island Crossing State Park
activities.description: Beautiful multi-use trails.

16295.directions: 1083 Three Island Pk Dr<br />Glenns Ferry, ID 83623<br />(208) 366-2394
16295.description: Located just off Interstate 84 at the Glenns Ferry exit, the park offers a full-service campground, eight cabins, picnic areas, historical interpretive programs and a fascinating admission-free interpretive center.

5626.name: Alum Cave Bluff

activities.name: Alum Cave Bluff
activities.description: Beautiful hike 1st mile or so is fairly flat along the creek to the base of the mountain. Once the ascend starts it's strenous. The last part of the trail offers amazing views and there is a cable along the wall to hold on to as it is very steep abd rocky. If you are brave enough you can continue to Mount Le Conte for another 3 miles.

5626.directions: Take I40 to 411 then south to Gatlinburg.

2646.name: Sourland Mountain Preserve

activities.name: Sourland Mountain Preserve
activities.description: Sourland Mountain Preserve features 10 miles of hiking trails near Hillsborough, NJ.

2646.directions: Sourlands Mountain Preserve<br />East Mountain Road, Hillsborough, NJ 08844<br /><br /> From Route 287 Southbound:<br />Follow Route 287 South to Exit 17 (Somerville/Routes 202/206 South). When the highwa**plit, <br />take Route 206 South. Follow the Route 206 South directions.<br /><br /> From 287 Northbound:<br />Follow Route 287 North to Route 22 West. Follow the Route 22 directions below.<br /><br /> From Route 22 Westbound:<br />Follow Route 22 to Routes 202/206 South. When the highwa**plit take Route 206 South. Follow <br />directions from Route 206 South.<br /><br /> From Route 22 Eastbound:<br />After Milltown Road in Bridgewater, take the next exit off of Route 22 eastbound, onto Route 28 <br />East. After 2 miles, Route 28 will intersect Route 206 South. Follow directions from Route 206 <br />South.<br /><br /> From 206 Southbound:<br />Follow Route 206 through Somerville and Hillsborough - approximately six miles from the <br />Somerville Circle to Route 514 which is Amwell Road. Make a right turn onto Amwell Road and <br />proceed two miles to East Mountain Road. Turn left onto East Mountain Road. Travel for one mile, <br />and you will see the Sourland Mountain Preserve entrance sign on the right.<br /> <br /> From 206 Northbound:<br />Follow Route 206 through Princeton and Montgomery. Traveling up a small ramp, make a left <br />onto Route 601. Follow Route 601 for a half mile, and make a right turn onto East Mountain Road <br />by Carrier Foundation. Travel for one mile, and you will see the Sourland Mountain Preserve <br />entrance sign on the left.

19032.name: Samuel S. Lewis State Park

activities.name: Samuel S. Lewis State Park
activities.description: The one-mile Hilltop Trail winds through a pine plantation, interesting rock formations and spectacular scenic views. This easy hike also takes visitors past the George E. Stine Arboretum. Over the years, the arboretum has been severely damaged by storms and high winds. However, it still contains European beech, persimmon, concolor fir, English yew and other unique species, capturing a piece of the landscape's past. Use the Short Cut Trail, a short loop, to more fully explore the pine plantation.

19032.directions: Samuel S. Lewis State Park is in southcentral Pennsylvania, York County, and is about 12 miles east of York, Pennsylvania. From the Wrightsville exit of US 30 follow Cool Creek Road south about 1.5-miles to Mt. Pisgah Road and the park.
19032.description: This 85-acre state park is dominated by Mt. Pisgah, an 885-foot high ridge that separates Kreutz Creek Valley and East Prospect Valley. The park landscape also consists of mowed grass fields on the northern and eastern park slopes, a pine plantation in the southern area and mature woods in the western section.

5650.name: Benton MacKaye Trail 22: Campsite 98 to Noland Divide Tr Jct.

activities.name: Benton MacKaye Trail 22: Campsite 98 to Noland Divide Tr Jct.
activities.description: Section 22 of the Benton MacKaye trail runs about 19 miles between Campsite 98 and the Noland Divide Trail Junction. This section roughly follows the shore of the beautiful Fontana Lake.

5650.directions: In the Great Smoky Mountain National Park

19034.name: Shawnee State Park

activities.name: Shawnee State Park
activities.description: Excellent trail system.

19034.directions: US 30 and PA 96 pass through Shawnee State Park.
19034.description: Shawnee State Park is 3,983 acres of Pennsylvania's scenic Ridge and Valley Province. Ten miles west of the historic town of Bedford along US 30, Shawnee has modern recreational facilities that blend into the natural environment. A focal point of the park is the 451-acre Shawnee Lake.

activities.name: Schenley Park
activities.description: 2 mile hiking trail located near Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

22054.name: Catamount Trail

activities.name: Catamount Trail
activities.description: Follow one of two trails, marked with blue dots or yellow dots. These trails climb up through a number of switchbacks with 2 overlooks along the way featuring beautiful views of the valley below. The trail crosses through a grassy area called the Garden of Eden and winds along the creek to a point where you can enjoy views of the stunning Pikes Peak.

22054.directions: US 24 West from Colorado Springs. From Cascade traffic light, drive 4 miles and take second exit marked Green Mountain Falls, Chipita Park. Take the ramp down on the main street, Ute Pass Ave.

5678.name: Appalachian Trail 058: James River to Blue Ridge Parkway

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 058: James River to Blue Ridge Parkway
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs from the foot bridge crossing of the James River to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Along the way it passes the John's Hollow shelter, Bluff Mountain, and Punchbowl Shelter.

5679.name: Appalachian Trail 057: Petites Gap to James River

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 057: Petites Gap to James River
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs down from Petites Gap to the foot bridge crossing of the James River. It's 10 miles long, and passes Highcock Knob, Hickory Stand, and Matts Creek Shelter along the way.

5680.name: Appalachian Trail 056: Parkers Gap Road to Petites Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 056: Parkers Gap Road to Petites Gap
activities.description:
Section 56 of the AT runs 7 miles from the Parkers Gap Road parking area to Petites Gap. Along the way it passes Apple Orchard Mountain and Thunder Hill Shelter.<br />
Recommended parking location: "USFS 35 (Petites Gap)" lat=37.5594861311, lon=-79.4585577363

5681.name: Appalachian Trail 055: Jennings Creek Road to Parkers Gap Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 055: Jennings Creek Road to Parkers Gap Road
activities.description: Section 55 of the A.T. runs 11.5 miles from Jennings Creek Road (VA Hwy 614) to Parkers Gap Road (near the Blue Ridge Parkway). Along the way it passes Fork Mountain, Bryant Ridge Shelter, and Cornelius Creek Shelter.

5682.name: Appalachian Trail 054: Bearwallow Gap to Jennings Creek Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 054: Bearwallow Gap to Jennings Creek Road
activities.description: Section 54 of the Appalachian Trail runs from Bearwallow Gap (VA Hwy 43) to Jennings Creek Road. Along the way it passes Cove Mountain and the Cove Mountain Shelter.

5683.name: Appalachian Trail 053: Black Horse Gap to Bearwallow Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 053: Black Horse Gap to Bearwallow Gap
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail parallels the Blue Ridge parkway for 8 miles from Black Horse Gap to Bearwallow Gap. Along the way it passes Montvale Overlook, Harvey's Knob Overlook, Bobblet's Gap Shelter, Sharptop & Peaks of Otter Overlook, and Mills Gap.

5684.name: Appalachian Trail 052: US 220 to Black Horse Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 052: US 220 to Black Horse Gap
activities.description:
Section 52 runs 13.5 miles from US 220 to Black Horse Gap on the Blue Ridge Parkway. Along the way it passes the parking lot at US Hwy 11, Fullhart Knob, Fullhart Knob Shelter, Wilson Creek Shelter, and Blue Knob.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "US 11" lat=37.4037335852, lon=-79.8898617428

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 051: VA 624 to US 220
activities.description:
Section 51 is a long one, as it runs 25.5 miles from VA Hwy 624 to US Hwy 220. It passes a number of places along the way, though: VA Hwy 785, VA Hwy 311 near the town of Catawba, Johns Spring Shelter, Catawba Mountain Shelter, McAfee Knob, Campbell Shelter, Tinker Mountain, and Lamberts Meadow Shelter.<br />
Recommended parking spot:"VA 311" lat=37.3801033629, lon=-80.0896480723

5686.name: Appalachian Trail 050: Craig Creek Valley to VA 624

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 050: Craig Creek Valley to VA 624
activities.description:
This section runs 14.6 miles from Craig Creek Valley to VA Hwy 624. Along the way it passes Brush Mountain and Pickle Branch Shelter.<br />
Note: the Google Maps location given is a best-guess for the southern end of this section of trail.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "VA 620" lat=37.3902832565, lon=-80.1960835423

5687.name: Appalachian Trail 059: Blue Ridge Parkway to Long Mountain Wayside

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 059: Blue Ridge Parkway to Long Mountain Wayside
activities.description: Section 59 of the AT runs 10 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway (see Google Maps Location) to Long Mountain Wayside. Along the way it passes the Lynchburg Reservoir, USFS 38, and the Brown Mountain Shelter.

5688.name: Appalachian Trail 060: Long Mountain Wayside to Salt Log Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 060: Long Mountain Wayside to Salt Log Gap
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs for 8.5 miles from the Long Mountain Wayside on US Hwy 60 to Salt Log Gap. Along the way it passes Bald Knob, Cow Camp Gap, and Cole Mountain.

5689.name: Appalachian Trail 062: Fish Hatchery Road to Tye River

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 062: Fish Hatchery Road to Tye River
activities.description:
This section of the AT runs for 9.5 miles from Fish Hatchery Road to Tye River (VA Hwy 56). Along the way it passes Maintop Mountain, The Priest Shelter, and The Priest mountain.<br />
Note: the Google Maps location is approximate, but close.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "VA 56 (Tye River)" lat=37.8383696705, lon=-79.0232431318

5690.name: Appalachian Trail 061: Salt Log Gap to Fish Hatchery Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 061: Salt Log Gap to Fish Hatchery Road
activities.description: Section 61 of the AT runs 8 miles from Salt Log Gap (USFS 63) to Fish Hatchery Road. It passes the Seeley-Woodworth shelter along the way.

5691.name: Appalachian Trail 063: Tye River to Reeds Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 063: Tye River to Reeds Gap
activities.description: This section of the AT begins at Tye River and runs 10.5 miles to Reeds Gap. Along the way it passes Harpers Creek shelter, Three Ridges, and Maupin Field shelter.

5692.name: Appalachian Trail 064: Reeds Gap to Rockfish Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 064: Reeds Gap to Rockfish Gap
activities.description: This, the final section of the AT before it enters Shenandoah National Park, runs 19.5 miles from Reeds Gap to Rockfish Gap. Along the way it crosses the Blue Ridge Parkway several times, roughly following its course.

5693.name: Appalachian Trail 049: Sinking Creek to Craig Creek Valley

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 049: Sinking Creek to Craig Creek Valley
activities.description:
This section of the trail runs 11.3 miles from Sinking Creek Valley (VA hwy 42) to Craig Creek Valley (VA hwy 621). It climbs out of the first valley, follows the ridgeline for a long ways, and then descends into the second valley. Along the way it passes VA hwy 630, Sarver Hollow Shelter, and the Niday Shelter.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "VA 630" lat=37.3514843774, lon=-80.3792072276

5694.name: Appalachian Trail 048: Johns Creek Valley to Sinking Creek

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 048: Johns Creek Valley to Sinking Creek
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian trail runs 7.4 miles up and over the ridge between Johns Creek Valley and Sinking Creek Valley. (Running between VA hwy 632/USFS 156 and VA hwy 42.) Along the way it passes Rocky Gap on VA hwy 601 and the Laurel Creek Shelter.

5696.name: Appalachian Trail 047: Stony Creek Valley to Johns Creek Valley

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 047: Stony Creek Valley to Johns Creek Valley
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 13.2 miles from Stony Creek Valley (VA hwy 365) to Johns Creek Valley.

2656.name: Boy Scout Camp

activities.name: Boy Scout Camp
activities.description: Boy Scout Camp features 4 miles of hiking trails near Alpine, NJ.

2656.directions: Enter from the dirt road at the north end of Andersen Ave in Closter

5699.name: Conasauga River Trail

activities.name: Conasauga River Trail
activities.description: Beautiful trail that crosses the Conasauga River several times.  Ample campsites available along the river.

5699.directions: Start/Eastern Trailhead: From the Ellijay square take GA 52 West for 9.5 miles to the Lake Conasauga Recreation Area sign. Turn right on FS 18 and continue 3.5 miles before turning right onto FS 68. After traveling approximately 6.0 miles, turn right on FS 64 at the three-way junction near Potatopatch Mountain. Proceed 1.4 miles to the Conasuaga River Trail sign and parking area.<br /><br /><br /><br />End/Western Trailhead: From the GA 52-US 411 intersection in Chatsworth, GA, take US 411 north for approximately 13.4 miles, past Etaon toward Tennga, to the community of Cisco. In Cisco, turn right onto the paved road (Old Hwy 2/FS 16) immediately before the Cisco Baptist Church (on the right). Continue on Old Hwy 2/FS 16 (the pavement ends; stay to the right at the fork) for approximately 3.2 miles, then turn right onto FS 17 at the Lake Conasauga sign.  Proceed straight ahead (17-A turns right) on FS 17 for approximately 3.6 mies before turning left onto FS 17-B at the Consasuga River parking area and trailhead.

19042.name: Tobyhanna State Park

activities.name: Tobyhanna State Park
activities.description: The rugged terrain of Tobyhanna State Park makes for challenging but rewarding hiking. All trails are blazed. Double blazes indicates a change of direction or a junction of two trails.

19042.directions: The park entrance is 2.1 miles north of the community of Tobyhanna on PA 423. PA 423 intersects with I-380, 2.5 miles south of the park entrance. The park can also be reached from Interstate 84 via PA 507, PA 191 and PA 423, a total distance of 11.4 miles.
19042.description: Tobyhanna State Park is in scenic Monroe and Wayne counties in northeastern Pennsylvania. The 5,440-acre park includes the 170-acre Tobyhanna Lake. Tobyhanna is derived from an American Indian word meaning "a stream whose banks are fringed with alder." Gouldsboro State Park is nearby.

19012.name: Penn-Roosevelt State Park

activities.name: Penn-Roosevelt State Park
activities.description: Penn-Roosevelt State Park is a 43-acre park in the Seven Mountains region. It is surrounded by RothrockState Forest and has hiking, horseback riding, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and camping available for visitors. The trails are mainly on nearby state forest land.

19012.directions: The park is easily reached from US 322, one-half mile east of Potters Mills (where US 322 changes from two to four lanes) turn south onto Crowfield Road (six miles to park). Or further east, turn south, (near the runaway truck ramp) onto Stone Creek Road (also six miles to park).<br /> <br />Penn-Roosevelt can also be reached from Greenwood Furnace State Park. Turn onto Broad Mountain Road at the park office. Follow the Penn-Roosevelt signs (12 miles to the park). Obtain a copy of the Rothrock State Forest Public Use Map from Greenwood Furnace State Park or the Bureau of Forestry office in Huntingdon.
19012.description: Penn-Roosevelt State Park is a 43-acre park in the Seven Mountains region. It is surrounded by RothrockState Forest and has hiking, horseback riding, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and camping available for visitors.

5716.name: Appalachian Trail 065: Rockfish Gap to Jarman Gap (Skyline Dr.)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 065: Rockfish Gap to Jarman Gap (Skyline Dr.)
activities.description: This is the first section of the AT in Shenandoah National Park, and it begins at Rockfish Gap on I-64 and runs for 8 miles to Jarman Gap on Skyline Drive.

5717.name: Appalachian Trail 066: Jarman Gap to Browns Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 066: Jarman Gap to Browns Gap
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 15 miles through Shenandoah National Park from Jarman Gap on Skyline Drive to Browns Gap. Along the way it passes the Calf Mountain Shelter, Calf Mountain, and the Blackrock Hut.

5718.name: Appalachian Trail 067: Browns Gap to Simmons Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 067: Browns Gap to Simmons Gap
activities.description: This is the 67th section of the Appalachian Trail, and it runs 12 miles through Shenandoah National Park from Browns Gap to Simmons Gap. Along the way it passes the Doyles River Overlook, Doyles River Trailhead, Big Flat Mountain, County Line Mountain, the Ivy Creek Overlook, and Pinefield Hut. The trail roughly follows Skyline Drive.

5719.name: Appalachian Trail 068: Simmons Gap to Swift Run Gap (US 33)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 068: Simmons Gap to Swift Run Gap (US 33)
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 9.5 miles from Simmons Gap to Swift Run Gap on US Hwy 33 through Shenandoah National Park. Along the way it passes the Hightop Hut and Hightop mountain.

5720.name: Appalachian Trail 069: Swift Run Gap to Fishers Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 069: Swift Run Gap to Fishers Gap
activities.description:
This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 18.6 miles from Swift Run Gap on US Hwy 33 to Fishers Gap through Shenandoah National Park. Along the way it passes the Bearfence Mountain Shelter, Bootens Gap, Hazeltop, and Milam Gap.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "Bootens Ga" lat=38.4683778493, lon=-78.4574569224

5721.name: Appalachian Trail 070: Fishers Gap to Skyland Service Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 070: Fishers Gap to Skyland Service Road
activities.description:
This section of the AT runs from Fishers Gap to the Skyland Service Road through Shenandoah National Park in Virginia. Along the way it passes the Rock Spring Hut.<br />
Recommended parking spot: "Skyland South" lat=38.586851174, lon=-78.3835166033

5722.name: Appalachian Trail 071: Skyland Service Road to Thornton Gap (US 211)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 071: Skyland Service Road to Thornton Gap (US 211)
activities.description:
This section of the AT runs 9.5 miles from the Skyland Service Road to Thornton Gap on US Hwy 211. Along the way it passes Stony Man, The Pinnacle, and Mary's Rock.<br />
<br />
This portion of the AT lies in the Shenandoah National Park.

5723.name: Appalachian Trail 072: Thornton Gap to Gravel Springs Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 072: Thornton Gap to Gravel Springs Gap
activities.description:
This section of the A.T. runs 14.5 miles from Thornton Gap to Gravel Springs Gap. Along the way it passes the Pass Mountain Shelter, Pass Mountain, Elk Wallow, Hogback Mountain, Little Hogback Overlook, and the Gravel Springs Hut.<br />
<br />
This section of the AT lies in the Shenandoah National Park.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots:<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7677227493, lon=-78.2335947105<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7587469474, lon=-78.2621556539<br />
"Skyline Dr" lat=38.7611039627, lon=-78.2823262856<br />
"Elk Wallow" lat=38.7387592425, lon=-78.3085782481

5724.name: Appalachian Trail 073: Gravel Springs Gap to US 211 (Front Royal)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 073: Gravel Springs Gap to US 211 (Front Royal)
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 13.2 miles from Gravel Springs Gap to US Hwy 211 (Front Royal) through Shenandoah National Park. This is the last section of the AT in Shenandoah. Along the way it passes North Marshall, Compton Peak, Compton Gap, and the Tom Floyd Wayside.

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 074: US 522 to VA 55
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 8.2 miles from US Hwy 522 to VA Hwy 55/I-66. Along the way it passes High Knob and the Jim & Molly Denton Shelter.

5726.name: Appalachian Trail 075: VA 55 to Ashby Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 075: VA 55 to Ashby Gap
activities.description: The AT runs 11.8 miles from VA Hwy 55 (I-66) to Ashby Gap (VA Hwy 601). Along the way it passes Manassas Gap shelter, Blue Mountain, and Dick's Dome shelter.

2661.name: Baldpate Mountain

activities.name: Baldpate Mountain
activities.description: Baldpate Mountain features 10 miles of hiking trails near Lambertville, NJ.

2661.directions: From I-95: Take Rt. 29 N to Church Rd.<br /><br />From Lambertville, Take Rt. 29 S. to Church Road.  Turn left and follow Church Rd. until you come to the intersection with Fiddler's Creed Rd.  Park on the Access Road for Washington Crossing SP.

5728.name: Appalachian Trail 077: Snickers Gap to Keys Gap (WV 9)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 077: Snickers Gap to Keys Gap (WV 9)
activities.description:
The Appalachian Trail runs 13.5 miles from Snickers Gap (VA Hwy 7) to Keys Gap (WV Hwy 9). Along the way it passes Raven Rocks, the Blackburn Trail Center, and the David Lesser Memorial shelter.<br />
<br />
If you are south bound, pick up the AT trail descriptions in Virginia. (Or click here.)

5729.name: Appalachian Trail 078: Keys Gap to Potomac River

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 078: Keys Gap to Potomac River
activities.description:
This is the final section of the AT in West Virginia, and it runs for 6.3 miles from Keys Gap to the Potomac River. Along the way it passes Loudoun Heights.<br />
If you are north bound, pick up the AT trail descriptions in Maryland (or click here).

19046.name: Upper Pine Bottom State Park

activities.name: Upper Pine Bottom State Park
activities.description: Upper Pine Bottom State Park provides access to the hiking tails of Tiadaghton State Forest.

19046.directions: Upper Pine Bottom State Parks is in Lycoming County, Pennsylvania and is along PA 44, west of Waterville.
19046.description: Upper Pine Bottom State Park provides visitors with a welcome rest area. Visitors often use the parking area of this small roadside picnic site for access to hiking, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling and hunting on surrounding Tiadaghton State Forest. Little Pine State Park maintains Upper Pine Bottom.

5736.name: Appalachian Trail 079: Potomac River to Weverton Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 079: Potomac River to Weverton Road
activities.description:
This section of the Appalachian Trail runs a short 3.3 miles from the crossing of the Potomac River to Weverton Road. It follows the Potomac for most of that length.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot: <br />
"Shenandoah Street" lat=39.3215735137, lon=-77.7432830231<br />
<br />
Note: If you are southbound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in West Virginia (or just click here).

5737.name: Appalachian Trail 080: Weverton Road to Crampton Gap

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 080: Weverton Road to Crampton Gap
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 6.7 miles from Weverton Road to Crampton Gap. Along the way it passes the Ed Garvey shelter.

5738.name: Appalachian Trail 082: Turners Gap to I-70 Footbridge (US 40)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 082: Turners Gap to I-70 Footbridge (US 40)
activities.description: The Appalachian Trail runs 4.9 miles from Turners Gap (Alt US 40) to a footbridge over I-70 (US 40). Along the way it passes the Washington Monument Road and Boonsboro Mountain Road.

5739.name: Appalachian Trail 083: I-70 Footbridge to Wolfsville Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 083: I-70 Footbridge to Wolfsville Road
activities.description:
Section 83 of the AT runs 8.6 miles from the footbridge over I-70 to Wolfsville Road (MD Hwy 17). Along the way it passes the Pine Knob shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"US 40 (Annapolis Rock)" lat=39.5354997064, lon=-77.6037213741

5740.name: Appalachian Trail 084: Wolfsville Road to Raven Rock Hollow (MD 491)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 084: Wolfsville Road to Raven Rock Hollow (MD 491)
activities.description: The AT runs 4.1 miles between Wolfsville Road (MD Hwy 17) and Raven Rock Hollow (MD 491). Along the way it passes the Ensign Cowall shelter, MD Hwy 77, and Warner Gap Road.

5741.name: Appalachian Trail 085: Raven Rock Hollow to MD/PA Line

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 085: Raven Rock Hollow to MD/PA Line
activities.description:
Section 85 of the AT runs 5.9 miles from Raven Rock Hollow to the MD/PA state line. Along the way it passes the Raven Rock shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots:<br />
"Warner Gap" lat=39.6560559927, lon=-77.5382287347<br />
"High Rock" lat=39.6949074627, lon=-77.5233980836<br />
<br />
Note: If you are north bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in Pennsylvania (or just click here).

5742.name: Appalachian Trail 086: PA/MD Line to US 30 (Caledonia State Park)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 086: PA/MD Line to US 30 (Caledonia State Park)
activities.description:
The Appalachian Trail runs 17.9 miles between the PA/MD state line and US Hwy 30 (Caledonia State Park).<br />
<br />
Along the way it passes Mount Dunlop, PA Hwy 16, Mentzer Gap Rd., Deer Lick Shelter, Rattlesnake Run Rd., Antietam Shelter, Tumbling Run Rd., Tumbling Run Shelter, Snowy Mountain, Snowy Mountain Rd., PA Hwy 233, and Rocky Mountain Shelter.<br />
<br />
Note: If you are south bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in Maryland (or click here).

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 087: US 30 to PA 233
activities.description: The AT runs 19.6 miles from US Hwy 30 (Caledonia State Park) to PA Hwy 233. Along the way it passes Quarry Gap shelter, Pine Flat Ridge, Birch Run shelter, Shippensburg-Arendtsville Road (Big Flat), Dead Woman's Hollow, Toms Run shelter, and Old Shippensburg Road.

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 088: PA 233 to PA 94
activities.description: The Appalachian Trail runs 10.7 miles from PA Hwy 233 to PA Hwy 94. Along the way it passes Old Railroad Bed Road 2, Green Mountain Road (Tagg Run), and PA Hwy 34 (Hunter's Run).

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 089: PA 94 to PA 174
activities.description:
This section of the AT runs 8.8 miles from PA Hwy 94 to PA Hwy 174. Along the way the trail passes Sheet Iron Roof Road, Mountain Road, an unnamed road, the Alec Kennedy shelter, and it finally hits PA Hwy 174 in the town of Boiling Springs.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"Sheet Iron Roof Road" lat=40.0931256145, lon=-77.1641046656

5746.name: Appalachian Trail 090: PA 174 (Boiling Springs) to PA 944

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 090: PA 174 (Boiling Springs) to PA 944
activities.description:
This section of the AT runs 12.3 miles from PA Hwy 174 in Boiling Springs to PA Hwy 944. <br />
<br />
Along the way it passes PA Hwy 74, Lisborn Road, Trindle Road, Old Stonehouse Road, I-76, US Hwy 11, Bernheisel Bridge Rd., I-81, and Sherwood Drive.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spots: <br />
"Lisborn Road" lat=40.1832287546, lon=-77.1115160597<br />
"Trindle Road" lat=40.1950482607, lon=-77.1083223753<br />
"Sherwood Drive" lat=40.2738983526, lon=-77.0994747247

5747.name: Appalachian Trail 091: PA 944 to Clarks Ferry Bridge

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 091: PA 944 to Clarks Ferry Bridge
activities.description:
The AT runs 14.6 miles from PA Hwy 944 to the Clarks Ferry Bridge. Along the way it passes the Darlington shelter, Millers Gap Rd., PA Hwy 850, Cove Mountain, Cove Mountain shelter, US Hwy 11/PA Hwy 274, and the town of Duncannon.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"PA 850" lat=40.3217637152, lon=-77.0781507863

5748.name: Appalachian Trail 092: Clarks Ferry Bridge (Duncannon) to PA 325

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 092: Clarks Ferry Bridge (Duncannon) to PA 325
activities.description:
Section 92 of the AT runs 16.7 miles from Clarks Ferry Bridge in Duncannon to PA Hwy 325. Along the way the trail passes Clarks Ferry shelter, PA Hwy 225, and the Peters Mountain shelter.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"PA 225" lat=40.4119472696, lon=-76.9300555452

5749.name: Appalachian Trail 093: PA 325 to Swatara Gap (PA 72)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 093: PA 325 to Swatara Gap (PA 72)
activities.description: The Appalachian Trail runs 17.4 miles between PA Hwy 325 and Swatara Gap (PA Hwy 72). Along the way it passes the Rausch Gap shelter and Rausch Gap.

5750.name: Appalachian Trail 094: Swatara Gap to PA 183

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 094: Swatara Gap to PA 183
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 20.7 miles from Swatara Gap to PA Hwy 183. Along the way the trail passes PA Hwy 72, I-81, Little Mountain, the William Penn shelter, PA Hwy 645, PA Hwy 501, the 501 shelter, and Summer Hill.

5751.name: Appalachian Trail 095: PA 183 to Port Clinton Post Office

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 095: PA 183 to Port Clinton Post Office
activities.description: This section of the Appalachian Trail runs 14.4 miles from PA Hwy 183 to the Port Clinton Post Office. Along the way it passes the Eagle's Nest shelter.

5752.name: Appalachian Trail 096: Port Clinton to Blue Mountain Summit (PA 309)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 096: Port Clinton to Blue Mountain Summit (PA 309)
activities.description:
Section 96 of the Appalachian Trail runs a lengthy 26.7 miles from the town of Port Clinton to the Summit of Blue Mountain (PA Hwy 309).<br />
<br />
Along the way the trail passes the Windsor Furnace shelter, The Pinnacle, the Eckville Shelter, Hawk Mountain Road, and the Allentown Hiking Club shelter.

5753.name: Appalachian Trail 098: Lehigh Gap to PA 33

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 098: Lehigh Gap to PA 33
activities.description: This section of the AT runs 20.7 miles from Lehigh Gap to PA Hwy 33. Along the way the trail passes Little Gap, Smith Gap, the Leroy A. Smith shelter, and the Chesnut Ridge High Point.

5754.name: Appalachian Trail 099: PA 33 to Delaware River Bridge

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 099: PA 33 to Delaware River Bridge
activities.description:
This is the last section of the Appalachian Trail in Pennsylvania, and it runs 15.8 miles from PA Hwy 33 to the Delaware River Bridge on the New Jersey border. Along the way it passes the Blue Mountain High Point, PA Hwy 191 (Fox Gap), the Kirkridge shelter, Godfrey Ridge, Mount Minsi, and Delaware Water Gap.<br />
Note: if you are north bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail descriptions in New Jersey (or just click here).

5755.name: Appalachian Trail 100: Delaware River Bridge to Millbrook-Blairstown Road

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 100: Delaware River Bridge to Millbrook-Blairstown Road
activities.description:
This, the 100th section of the Appalachian Trail and the first section in New Jersey, runs 13.7 miles from the Delaware River Bridge to Millbrook-Blairstown Road. Along the way it passes Dunnfield Creek Natural Area, Mount Nebo, Sunfish Pond, Shawnee Mountain, Upper Yards Creek Reservoir, Mohican Outdoor Center/camp Rd, and BM Catfish.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"Dunnfield Creek Natural Area" lat=40.9716455429, lon=-75.1252139109<br />
<br />
Note: if you are south bound, pick up the Appalachian trail section descriptions in Pennsylvania (or just click here.)

5756.name: Appalachian Trail 101: Millbrook-Blairstown Road to Culvers Gap (US 206)

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 101: Millbrook-Blairstown Road to Culvers Gap (US 206)
activities.description: The Appalachian Trail runs 14.5 miles from Milbrook-Blairstown Road to Culvers Gap (US Hwy 206). Along the way the trail passes Blue Mountain Lakes Road and the Brink Road shelter.

3709.name: Carvin's Cove Trail system

activities.name: Carvin's Cove Trail system
activities.description: Carvin's Cove Trail system features 30 miles of hiking trails near Roanoke, VA.

3709.directions: Two entrances: 1. Reservior Road off US 11 at Hollins. Must obtain access permit to trails at office at this location. 2.Carvin's Cove Road off of HWY 311 near Salem, VA.Go to end of Carvin's Cove raod, new parking lot being constructed for trail users.

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 103: NJ 23 to NJ 284
activities.description: The AT runs 9.8 miles from NJ Hwy 23 (High Point State Park) to NJ Hwy 284. Along the way it passes New Jersey's High Point, the High Point shelter, NJ Hwy 519, Goldsmith Lane, Unionville Road, Quarry Road, and Lott Road.

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 104: NJ 284 to NJ 94
activities.description: The AT runs 10.8 miles between NJ Hwy 284 and NJ Hwy 94. Along the way it passes the Pochuck Mountain shelter, NJ Hwy 565, Vernon Valley, and County Road 517.

3712.name: Fountainhead Regional Park

activities.name: Fountainhead Regional Park
activities.description: Fountainhead Regional Park features 5 miles of hiking trails near Fairfax, VA.

3712.directions: "Fountainhead Regional park is about 10 miles south of Fairfax, VA.  Take VA 123 south (Ox Road) then take a left onto Hampton Road, the park is three miles down on the left. For more info call the park headquarters at: 703-250-9124.  For 24-hour trail co

5761.name: Appalachian Trail 106: NJ/NY Line to NY 17A

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 106: NJ/NY Line to NY 17A
activities.description:
The AT runs 5.9 miles from the NJ/NY state line to NY Hwy 17A.<br />
<br />
Recommended parking spot:<br />
"NY 17a" lat=41.2441108209, lon=-74.2866349565<br />
<br />
Note: if you are south bound, pick up the Appalachian Trail section descriptions in New Jersey (or just click here).

activities.name: Appalachian Trail 107: NY 17A to NY 17
activities.description: The AT runs 12 miles from NY Hwy 17A to NY Hwy 17 (near I-87). Along the way the trail passes the Wildcat shelter, County Road 5, West Mombasha Road, Mombasha Lake, East Mombasha Road, and County Road 19.

19051.name: Worlds End State Park

activities.name: Worlds End State Park
activities.description: The over 20 miles of hiking trails of Worlds End State Park are mostly rocky with steep sections that climb the surrounding mountains. Hikers should wear proper footgear and be extra cautious in the winter and spring when trail surfaces can be frozen or icy.

19051.directions: The park is along PA 154 and is easily reached from: PA 87 from Williamsport and west; PA 42 from I-80 and south; and PA 87 from Dushore and the north and east.
19051.description: Worlds End State Park is in a narrow S-shaped valley of the Loyalsock Creek just south of Forksville, Sullivan County. Loyalsock Canyon Vista, reached via Mineral Spring and Cold Run roads, provides outstanding views, especially during fall foliage.

3716.name: Poor Farms

activities.name: Poor Farms
activities.description: This is definitely a locals trail system, and despite the complete and utter lack of trail markings, it appears to be legal (as far as I can tell). While I wouldn't recommend driving from out of town to check this trail out, for those living nearby I am sure it is a real gem. There are some great trails snaking through the forest here, but it is truly a massive spiderweb. If you are a first timer here, just start exploring. You will come out eventually. When you do, head back in and try a different fork in the trail. Wash, rinse, and repeat!

3716.directions: Take the Ashland exit off of I-95 and follow Hwy 57 west for about 1.5 miles out of town.  Turn left at Poor Farm Park (there is a middle school there + soccor fields).  Park in the gravel lots.  trails begin on either side of the woods.

3719.name: Turkeycock Mountain

activities.name: Turkeycock Mountain
activities.description: Turkeycock Mountain features 20 miles of hiking trails near Franklin County, VA.

3719.directions: "This trail is situated in the Southeastern corner of Franklin County and the northeastern corner of Henry County. From Martinsville: Travel north on Rt 108. Rt. 108 changes to Rt 890 at the county line. After crossing county line go approx 5 miles to Sno

3720.name: Wakefield

activities.name: Wakefield
activities.description: Wakefield features 0 miles of hiking trails near Annandale, VA.

3720.directions: From 495 Exit 54 to VA 620-Braddock Rd West, From Braddock Rd take a right at the first stoplight west of the 495 exit on to Wakefield Park Rd(see "Wakefield Park" sign in trail photos). Continue north on the park road, turn left into the Audrey Moore RECenter parking lot.  See trailhead kiosk(see trail photos) by tennis courts at the north end of parking lot from RECenter for trailhead information.

3721.name: Walnut Creek

activities.name: Walnut Creek
activities.description: Walnut Creek features 35 miles of hiking trails near Charlottesville, VA.

3721.directions: On 29S go out of town (Charlottesville) and follow the signs

3722.name: Explore Park

activities.name: Explore Park
activities.description: 13 mile hiking trail located near Roanoke, Virginia

3722.directions: Milepost 115 Blue Ridge Parkway. As you enter park Trail head is across from Main Welcome Center

3724.name: Candlers Mountain

activities.name: Candlers Mountain
activities.description: Candlers Mountain features 25 miles of hiking trails near Lynchburg, VA.

3724.directions: mountain overlooking city of lynchburg and Liberty University. Close to lynchburg mall, 460 and 29.  Can get maps from www.bikesunlimited.com

3726.name: Great Falls National Park

activities.name: Great Falls National Park
activities.description: Great Falls National Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Mclean, VA.

3726.directions: From I-495 exit 13 northwest of McLean take Route 193 (Georgetown Pike) west towards Great Falls.  Go about four miles, then turn right on Old Dominion Drive, which becomes the park entrance.  You will see signs for Difficult Run trail and parking on your left.  You can park here for free or continue about 1 mile to the park entrance a pay a fee.

3729.name: Newport News Park

activities.name: Newport News Park
activities.description: Newport News Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Newport News, VA.

3729.directions: From VA Beach, I 64 west to exit 250 on Fort Eustis Blvd. (Route 105) heading east.  Immediately turn left on Jefferson Ave. (Route 143) nd cross over the City Reservoir.  Go about 1 mle to Newport News Park's second entrance.  There are signs for the trail.

3733.name: Pocahantos State Park

activities.name: Pocahantos State Park
activities.description: Pocahantos State Park features 10 miles of hiking trails near Richmond, VA.

3733.directions: In Chesterfield County, about 20 miles south of Richmond. <br /><br />Exit 61 off I-95, go west on Route 10 to Beach Road. The park is four miles on right.  <br /><br />Enter the park (Parking fee = $2.00).  Park near the CCC museum.  Take the "Old Mill" bicycle trail to the right and the single tracks will be up ahead a ways on the right.

3734.name: Buttermilk

activities.name: Buttermilk
activities.description: This is one of the best trails in the James River Park system, with cool rocks, views of the river, and some great trails to hike or run on.

3734.directions: Located with the City of Richmond Park System along the James River on the south side between the Lee Bridge and the Boulevard (Nickel) bridge (East and West) and between the train tracks and Riverside Drive (North and South).  Good access at the Reedy Creek parking lot.  Can also be accessed off of the end of the Nickel bridge, but you must cross the road, which can be dangerous, or from Belle Isle.<br /><br />Reedy Creek river access is located off of Riverside Drive.  <br /><br />A short section of the Buttermilk trail continues west of Boulevard.

3735.name: Belle Isle

activities.name: Belle Isle
activities.description: Belle Isle features 2 miles of hiking trails near Richmond, VA.

3735.directions: This is a small island located pretty much in downtown Richmond.  There is a parking lot off of Tredegar street  (from downtown take 5th or 7th street south, take a right on Tredegar Street, go past the Tredegar iron works and park under the train tracks.

3736.name: Powhite Park

activities.name: Powhite Park
activities.description: Powhite Park features 8 miles of hiking trails near Richmond, VA.

3736.directions: Take 95 south to 195 West\South to Powhite Parkway (Route 76) soth towards Chesterfield.  Take the Jahnke Rd. East exit just after crossing over the Chippenham Parkway.  As you head east on Jahnke Rd., you will cross back under the Chippenham Parkway and you will see almost immediately the Powhite Park entrance (on your left across the median).  Drive another 50 yards to the right at the Chippenham Medical Center and make a U turn.  The park will be on your right.  Follow the road back and park near the circle drive.   The trailhead starts into the woods at the far end of the circule drive.

3737.name: Lake Accotink Network

activities.name: Lake Accotink Network
activities.description: Lake Accotink Network features 6 miles of hiking trails near Springfield, VA.

3737.directions: take 495 to the Braddock Rd. West exit. Off of Braddock road to the right is Wakefield park(*see wakefiled trails), continue past wakefield until you reach Southhampton Rd. Take a left onto southhampton rd. and follow until it dead ends onto Rolling Rd. Make a left onto Rolling road, and make a u-turn as soon as possible. this will bring you back towards Southhampton Rd. As soon as you pass over the railroad tracks, take the first right onto the service road which will bring you to the trail head. Parking is at the trailhead.

3738.name: Forest Hill Park

activities.name: Forest Hill Park
activities.description: Forest Hill Park features 2 miles of hiking trails near Richmond, VA.

3738.directions: Forest hill park is between Forest Hill Avenue and Riverside drive near the river on the south side of Richmond, approximately between Boulevard and Belvidere.  Accessible from Reedy Creek by going through the tunnel under Riverside Drive.

3739.name: Colvin Run Trail

activities.name: Colvin Run Trail
activities.description: Colvin Run Trail features 4 miles of hiking trails near Reston, VA.

3739.directions: Start in the Skate Nation parking lot (back left-hand corner) off of Michael Faraday Court in Reston. To get there take the Dulles Toll Road to exit for Whiele Avenue. Go North on Whiele and make a right onto Sunset Hills Road. Make the first left onto Michael Faraday Court. Trailhead is at the end of the street.

3740.name: Folkstone Park Trail

activities.name: Folkstone Park Trail
activities.description: Folkstone Park Trail features 2 miles of hiking trails near Herndon, VA.

3740.directions: From West Ox Road travel east on Folkstone Drive. In about two tenths of a mile you will see a guard rail in front of the woods on the right hand side. Just at the end of the guard rail is the beginning of a trail. There is no sign for the park; just a small post with a FCPA sticker and a blue dot. From the Fox Mill Road side; go south on Fox Mill Road and turn right onto Westwood Hills Drive. On the right, there will be a small field with a sign that says Folkstone Park - Little Difficult Run Stream Valley Park. In the back left of this field the trail begins.

3741.name: Elizabeth Furnace

activities.name: Elizabeth Furnace
activities.description: Elizabeth Furnace features 15 miles of hiking trails near Front Royal, VA.

3741.directions: Trails Located in George Washington National Forest, approx 30 minutes north of Lurray Caverns off of Rt 340/522S from I-66W.  From exit 6 off of Route 66W, proceed south and turn right at about 1.2 miles.  There will be signs to Elizabeth Furnace Day Use area grounds.  Also, check out www.more-mtb.org for more detailed directions.  I'm not always the best person to ask for directions. :)

3742.name: Fox Mill District Park

activities.name: Fox Mill District Park
activities.description: 4 mile hiking trail located near Reston, Virginia

3742.directions: The trail is located in Reston, VA and connects with both Folkstone Park and The Glade. This trail is part of a network of trails which leads from West Ox Road in Herndon and eventually will lead you to the Cross County Trail. To get there by car from the Dulles Toll Road; take Reston Parkway south. Turn left at the light for Lawyers Road. Make immediate right onto Fox Mill Road. Go one or two miles and make left turn into entrance for Crossfield Elementary School. Park in lot on right hand side next to the soccer field.

3743.name: Burke Lake

activities.name: Burke Lake
activities.description: Burke Lake features 4 miles of hiking trails near Burke, VA.

3743.directions: Burke Lake Park off of Ox Road.

18080.name: Allamuchy Mountain State Park

activities.name: Allamuchy Mt. State Park
activities.description: Allamuchy Mt. State Park features 14 miles of hiking trails near Hackettstown, NJ.

18080.directions: Allamuchy Mountain<br />State Park is located three miles north of Hackettstown between Willow Grove/ Waterloo Road<br />(Route 604) on the east, Route 517 on the west, and Cranberry Lake (Route 206) on the north.
18080.description: The Musconetcong River, with some of the best trout fishing in the state, winds through Allamuchy Mountain State Park. Several miles of trails crisscross through the forests and marshlands of the park.

18082.name: Barnegat Lighthouse State Park

activities.name: Barnegat Lighthouse State Park
activities.description: One of the last remnants of maritime forest on Long Beach Island is found at Barnegat Lighthouse State Park. The forest, which is dominated by Black Cherry, Sassafras, Eastern Red Cedar, and American Holly, is an important resting and feeding area for migratory birds on their long journey to and from their breeding sites. The Maritime Forest Trail is a 1/5-mile long, self-guided loop trail through this unique environment.

18082.directions: State Park is situated on the northern tip of Long Beach Island in Ocean County. The park can be reached by taking the Garden State Parkway to exit 63. From Route 72 east, turn left onto Long Beach Blvd. and then left onto Broadway. The park entrance is on the right.
18082.description: The site of Barnegat Lighthouse on the northern tip of Long Beach Island in Ocean County was regarded as one of the most crucial "change of course" points for coastal vessels. Vessels bound to and from New York along the New Jersey coastline depended on Barnegat Lighthouse to avoid the shoals extending from the shoreline. The swift currents, shifting sandbars, and the offshore shoals challenged the skills of even the most experienced sailor. The park is included as a maritime site on the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail.

3747.name: Freedom Park (aka:district Park)

activities.name: Freedom Park (aka:district Park)
activities.description: Freedom Park (aka:district Park) features 5 miles of hiking trails near Yorktown, VA.

3747.directions: From I-64, take exit 234 to Route 199. From Route 199, take the Longhill Road exit. Turn right onto Longhill Road. Stay on Longhill Road, which takes you into the park entrance. The trailhead is directly behind where the road ends. There is a Y intersection at the trail head. Bear to the left. The trail you see to the right is the end of the loop.

3748.name: W&od Trail

activities.name: W&od Trail
activities.description: W&od Trail features 90 miles of hiking trails near Northern Virginia, VA.

3748.directions: From DC take I-395 south to Shirlington, exit<br />7. Make your way to the back of the Shirlington movie theater and park<br />in the big parking lot located off of South Arlington Mill Dr. Once<br />parked the Four mile run trail is located across S Arlington Mill Dr.<br />and take a left toward Walter Reed Dr.

18085.name: Brendan T. Byrne State Forest

activities.name: Brendan T. Byrne State Forest
activities.description: Brendan T. Byrne State Forest has more than 25 miles of marked trails. The various trails and loops provide challenges ranging from long single track hiking trails to a trail accessible for people with disabilities. The Batona Trail is designed for hiking, cross country skiing, and snow shoeing (weather permitting). The Mount Misery Trail allows visitors the additional option of mountain biking, and the Cranberry Trail allows for access by wheelchairs in addition to all the other uses listed above.

18085.directions: From the NJ Turnpike, take exit 7 and follow Route 206 south to Route 38 east, to second traffic light, then turn onto Magnolia Road (Route 644). Follow Magnolia Road until you come to the Four-Mile Circle. From the circle take Route 72 east, at mile marker 1 make a left. There is a forest entrance sign on your left as you turn in. Take the first right and the office is on the left.
18085.description: Formerly known as Lebanon State Forest, visitors are greeted by the fresh scent of pines. Today's forested acres are a strong contrast to the barren, cleared land that existed in the 1800s. The Lebanon Glass Works was established in 1851 and was successful until 1867, when it shut down after depleting the supply of wood necessary for the furnace to operate.

3750.name: Lodi Farm

activities.name: Lodi Farm
activities.description: Lodi Farm features 17 miles of hiking trails near Fredericksburg, VA.

3750.directions: From 95  take  exit 130-A for Rte 3 East. Follow 1.5 miles take a right after crossing over Rappahanock River.Pass WalMart on right and follow 10 miles. Take a left onto Hollywood Farms road. Entrance is first dirt road after railroad tracks(1/4 mile). If gate is closed (rarely) do not park on street or ride up to trails on railroad tracks.Everthing South of RR Tracks are private.

18087.name: Cape May Point State Park

activities.name: Cape May Point State Park
activities.description: Excellent hiking area.

18087.directions: The park is located off the southern end of the Garden State Parkway. Cross over Cape May Bridge onto Lafayette Street, Cape May. At the intersection, bear right onto County Route 606, then left onto Lighthouse Avenue. From Route 9, take County Route 626, Seashore Road and cross the bridge. Follow directions as above.
18087.description: Although Cape May Lighthouse is a major attraction for many visitors to the area, the park's constantly changing shoreline, dunes, freshwater coastal marsh and ponds, forested islands and varied uplands make it a well-known location for viewing the fall bird migration. Located on the southern tip of New Jersey, Cape May Point State Park is a key site on the NJ Coastal Heritage Trail, with an environmental center that houses a classroom for interpretive programs and a museum on the area's natural and historic features.

18088.name: Cheesequake State Park

activities.name: Cheesequake State Park
activities.description: There are five designated trails at the park. The Red, Yellow, Green and Blue pathways are for hiking and walking use. The White Trail (multi-use) is designated for hiking and mountain biking. Trail lengths range from 1.5 to 3.5 miles. Trail difficulty ranges from easy to moderate with inclines.

18088.directions: The park is accessible from exit 120 off the Garden State Parkway and from Route 34. State Park signs are posted at critical intersections along the following routes:GSP, Route 34 South and North. For more detailed directions click here.
18088.description: Cheesequake State Park's uniqueness lies in its geographical location. Not only is it situated in the middle of the urban north and the suburban south, it lies in a transitional zone between two different ecosystems. Open fields, saltwater and freshwater marshes, a white cedar swamp, Pine Barrens, and a northeastern hardwood forest are the main characteristics of the park.

18089.name: Corson's Inlet State Park

activities.name: Corson
activities.description: Good area for hiking the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail.

18089.directions: The park is bisected by scenic Ocean Drive (Cape May County Route 619), connecting Ocean City and Strathmere-Sea Isle City. Ocean City is linked to the Garden State Parkway via southbound and northbound exit 25 (Roosevelt Boulevard-34th Street). Sea Isle City is accessible via the parkway southbound exit 17 or Route 9 northbound to JFK Boulevard. Follow signs to the park.
18089.description: Corson's Inlet State Park was established in 1969 to help protect and preserve one of the last undeveloped tracts of land along the state's oceanfront. The area's natural habitats are rich in the diversity of its wildlife with primary and secondary sand dune systems, shoreline overwash, marine estuaries and upland areas in which hundreds of wildlife species live and breed. The park offers outstanding scenic beauty and endless opportunities for observing a multitude of migratory and residential wildlife species. Corson's Inlet is extremely popular for hiking, fishing, crabbing, boating and sunbathing.

18090.name: Delaware and Raritan Canal State Park

activities.name: Delaware and Raritan Canal State Park
activities.description: The historic towpath found along the feeder and main canal is suitable for hiking, jogging and biking. Horseback riding is permitted on the main canal only. Motorized vehicles or ATV's are not permitted on trails in the park. In addition to the canal trail, patrons can access trails at the Six Mile Run Reservoir Site, Kingston greenway and Cook Natural Area Trails from the park office located in Kingston as well as one trail found within the Bull's Island Natural Area.

18090.directions: Parking is available in designated parking lots along the canal towpath. The main canal runs from Trenton to New Brunswick with a break at the Route 1 crossing. The feeder canal stretches from Trenton north to Frenchtown along the Delaware River.
18090.description: The Delaware and Raritan Canal State Park is one of central New Jersey's most popular recreational corridors for canoeing, jogging, hiking, bicycling, fishing and horseback riding. The canal and towpath are part of the National Recreational Trail System. The 70-mile linear park is a valuable wildlife corridor connecting fields and forests. With its 19th-century bridges, bridgetender houses, past and present locks, cobblestone spillways and hand-built stone-arched culverts, the canal is a tremendous attraction for history lovers. The upper reach of the feeder canal wanders through quaint New Jersey towns along the Delaware River such as Stockton and Lambertville. The main canal passes the Port Mercer canal house, through the charming village of Griggstown to Blackwells Mills, ending up in New Brunswick. Canoes can be rented at Griggstown and Princeton from private concessionaires. Most of the canal system remains intact today and is a reminder of the days when the delivery of freight depended upon a team of mules or steam tugboats. Nearly 36 miles of the main canal and 22 miles of the feeder canal still exist, with many historic structures along the canal.

18091.name: Double Trouble State Park

activities.name: Double Trouble State Park
activities.description: The Double Trouble Historic District has a self-guided, marked 1.5-mile loop nature trail and several miles of unmarked paths along sand service roads. Nature trail guides are available at the trailhead next to the cranberry packing house and at the park information building.

18091.directions: Garden State Parkway Southbound:  Take exit 77.  Turn left off exit ramp and travel 1/2 mile south on Double Trouble Road/ County Route 619 South to traffic signal.  Park entrance is straight ahead across Pinewald Keswick Road/County Route 618.
18091.description: Double Trouble State Park offers an outstanding example of the Pine Barrens ecosystem and a window into the Pine Barrens history. The park provides the protection and interpretation of over 8000 acres of significant natural, cultural, and recreational resources representative of the Pinelands National Reserve.   Its location and resource base afford an opportunity to introduce visitors to southern New Jersey's natural and cultural heritage. Both the natural environment, consisting of a high quality Pine Barrens watershed, and an extremely well preserved historic village associated with New Jersey cranberry agriculture and Atlantic White Cedar logging and milling industries are available to visitors at Double Trouble State Park.

3759.name: Northbank Trail

activities.name: Northbank Trail
activities.description: Northbank Trail features 2 miles of hiking trails near Richmond, VA.

3759.directions: Interstate 64 E/95 S get off on exit 75, bear to right, follow thrid st about eleven blocks to Byrd St, left on Byrd to 5th, right on 5th, right on tredegar at bottom of hill, go to parking lot for Belle Isle (other trails there!!).  Park and ride up gravel road on other side of chain-link fence from parking lot, cross wooden bridge and turn left.  go about two hundred yards to chain link fence-  trail on other side of fence, you can go around fence.

18096.name: Fort Mott State Park

activities.name: Fort Mott State Park
activities.description: An easy Nature Interpretive Trail can be found within the Park that is excellent for beginners. The trail is accessible for persons with disabilities. The NJ Coastal Heritage Trail Welcome Center accommodates displays defining Fort Mott's place in history and the environment.

18096.directions: Take I-295 or NJ Turnpike to exit 1 at Pennsville, Route 49 East to Fort Mott Road. Turn right onto Fort Mott Road and travel 3 miles. Park is located on right.
18096.description: Fort Mott was part of a coastal defense system designed for the Delaware River in the late 1800s. The fortifications seen today at Fort Mott were erected in 1896 in anticipation of the Spanish-American War. Today, visitors can wander through the old batteries following interpretive signs with detailed descriptions of the fort. Just beyond the fortifications is the Delaware River. The shoreline offers good spots for walking and picnicking. The NJ Coastal Heritage Trail Welcome Center accommodates displays defining Fort Mott's place in history and the environment.

3761.name: Prince William Forest Park

activities.name: Prince William Forest Park
activities.description: Prince William Forest Park features 6 miles of hiking trails near Triangle, VA.

3761.directions: 95 to exit 152, go towards Manassas on Rt 234 West-go approx 3 mile and park in Reid Elementary School parking lot.

18098.name: High Point State Park

activities.name: High Point State Park
activities.description: With over 50 miles of trails, High Point State Park offers visitors a variety of trail options throughout the year, Designated multiple-use trails are available for hiking, mountain biking, horseback riding, cross country skiing, snowshoeing, dogsledding and snowmobiling. Trails vary in length from one half-mile to 18 miles and take visitors through unique and diverse landscapes including an Atlantic white cedar swamp, mountain ridge tops with 360-degree views, dense forests, fields and wetlands.

18098.directions: Take Route 23 approximately 7 miles north of the town of Sussex, NJ, or 4 miles south of Port Jervis, NY.
18098.description: The view from High Point Monument, at 1,803 feet above sea level, is a spectacular panorama of rich farmland and forest, soft hills and lush valleys in three states. The blue line of the Delaware River divides the verdant ridges of New Jersey from those of Pennsylvania. High Point offers superb trails for hikers and skiers and quiet spots for campers and anglers. The land for High Point State Park, donated by Colonel Anthony R. and Susie Dryden Kuser, was dedicated as a park in 1923. The pleasant landscaping was designed by the Olmsted Brothers of Boston, a prominent landscape architectural firm of that time. The brothers were the sons of the eminent Frederick Law Olmsted, who designed Central Park.

3763.name: Lake Maury

activities.name: Lake Maury
activities.description: Lake Maury features 10 miles of hiking trails near Newport News, VA.

3763.directions: <br />Coming from south Hampton, go north on I-64 take the HAMPTON RDS CENTER PKWY WEST EXIT 261A. Go straight for about 3 miles. Turn RIGHT onto GATEWOOD RD. Follow road to the small parking area by lake.<br />

18100.name: Island Beach State Park

activities.name: Island Beach State Park
activities.description: The Island Beach State Park Discovery Trails System provides a self-guided experience through the nine plant communities of a barrier island. Wayside exhibits located along each trail interpret the natural and cultural stories of the park. There are a total of 8 trails, each under one mile. For a copy of the Discovery Trails brochure and map, please contact the Park Office.

18100.directions: Take Route 37 east to Route 35 south to park entrance.
18100.description: Shaped by storm and tides, Island Beach State Park is a narrow barrier island stretching for 10 miles between the restless Atlantic Ocean and the historic Barnegat Bay. Island Beach is one of New Jersey's last significant remnants of a barrier island ecosystem that once existed along much of the coast and is also one of the few remaining undeveloped barrier beaches on the north Atlantic coast. Over 3,000 acres and 10 miles of coastal dunes remain almost untouched since Henry Hudson first described New Jersey's coast from the ship, the Half Moon, in 1609.  Miles of sand dunes and white sandy beaches offer habitat to maritime plants and diverse wildlife that is almost the same as it was thousands of years ago. Island Beach contains outstanding examples of plant communities such as primary dunes, thicket, freshwater wetlands, maritime forest and tidal marshes. The state's largest osprey colony, as well as peregrine falcons, wading birds, shorebirds, waterfowl and migrating songbirds, are found here. Island Beach is nationally known as a unique resource with over 400 plants identified, including the largest expanses of beach heather in New Jersey.

18101.name: Jenny Jump State Forest

activities.name: Jenny Jump State Forest
activities.description: Eleven miles of hiking trails and three miles of hiking /mountain bike trails offer magnificent views of the mountains and scenic Mountain Lake. The Summit Trail, at an elevation of 1,090 feet, offers a view of the Delaware Water Gap and the Pequest Valley.

18101.directions: Take Route 80 to exit 12 to Hope. Turn onto Route 519 north at blinking light. At third right, turn onto Shiloh Road. Approximately 1 mile, turn right onto State Park Road.
18101.description: Jenny Jump State Forest is located in Warren County along the stunning rolling terrain of Jenny Jump Mountain Range. Panoramic vistas of the Highlands and the Kittatinny Mountains and Valley to the west, and scenic views of the Great Meadows in the east dramatically greet the visitor who climbs the narrow path leading to the top of Jenny Jump Mountain. Rocky outcroppings and boulders line the trail - evidence that great glaciers once covered what is now known as Jenny Jump State Forest.

3766.name: Peaks View Park
